direction.raw_text: (V.O) In between the years when the oceans drank Atlantis and the rise of the Sons of Aryas, there was an age undreamed of, when shining kingdoms lay spread across the world like blue mantles under the stars. Hither came Conan, the Cimmerian: a thief, a slayer, a king born of battle. Muffled sounds, as if underwater, echo: CLANGING swords, the guttural CRIES of combat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes closed, floating at peace within red glow of the womb. Suddenly, a flash of steel, as a sword pierces the womb, its tip not an inch from the baby's head. As the sword is ripped out, light streams in from outside, we travel with it, into the DIN of BATTLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A blonde-haired, armored AESIR RAIDER withdraws the bloody sword from the stomach of ISLENE, a wild-maned Cimmerian beauty, many months pregnant, now clutching her bloody stomach. Across a muddy battlefield, the air a maelstrom of falling snowflakes and embers from trees aflame, the powerfully built
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rallies his fellow CIMMERIANS, until he spots Islene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Islene!!! Wielding a broadsword, runes etched into its surface, Corin cuts a bloody path through his enemies, his eyes never leaving Islene. The Aesir standing over Islene LAUGHS as she claws at the earth behind her, trying to pull herself away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, now little whore. Did I get you or your little one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Islene's hand reaches back once again -- and it finds a fallen warrior's SWORD. In one fluid motion she swings the sword around her body and drives it into the gap in the Aesir's armor -- at his groin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd ask you the same. The Aesir HOWLS in agony, raising his sword to deliver the killing blow -- when another sword pierces his chest. The Aesir falls, revealing Corin standing behind him. Corin throws aside his horned helmet, and falls to his knees beside Islene, checking her wound. When he pulls his hands back they are coated in blood. Their eyes meet. Torment. Loss. They both know. She pulls a knife from the folds of her pelts, puts it in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cannot. Islene looks to her naked belly. The baby inside presses against its womb, a visible impression on her flesh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no time, husband. I would see my child's face. Islene's eyes flutter as she struggles. Corin lowers the knife. Islene's eyes lock with Corin's as he puts the knife to use. Never once does she scream. A moment later, Corin lifts the crying, blood-covered BOY up through the falling snowflakes to Islene's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A boy. He will be strong. A warrior with no equal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not speak, love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have never been able to still my tongue, and you will not this day. He will be wild, Corin. You must temper him. She shares one kiss with her child, its first taste not of mother's milk, but of her blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan. His--name--is--Conan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy's eyes are as deep and blue as the Eastern Sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CONAN CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small Cimmerian village lies in a heavily forested valley, a redoubt from the icy mountains surrounding it. Round wooden huts surround a stone-lined pit, where young
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ages 12-15 stand. Pollen drifts through the air, giving it an ethereal haze. At the center of the pit URAN, an elder Cimmerian warrior speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cimmerian warrior is like any other man. A Cimmerian warrior feels hunger. He feels cold. Like other men he may lie and cheat. (stares the boys down) But when a Cimmerian warrior hungers, he hungers only for the blood of his enemy. When he feels cold, it is the cold steel of his sword. When he lies, he lies in wait for his enemy. And when he cheats, he cheats death itself! Uran stops at the end of the line, where a boy stands a good two heads smaller than the rest. He is no more than eight, but his face is as stoic, driven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan! You are too young to be here. Withdraw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: determined, doesn't move an inch. The LARGEST TEEN menacingly steps up to the smaller boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said leave, motherless whelp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The hulking teen goes to shove Conan, but Conan pulls his arm towards him, lashing out with his other hand, punching the teen in the throat. The large boy goes down hard, hands and knees, gasping for air. A smattering of LAUGHS erupt from the boys, quickly silenced by Uran's stare. Uran hands out RIVER STONES to each boy, ending with Conan. The boys know what to do: they put the large stones in their mouths.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the black crag in the high pass stands a wooden training sword. The one who claims it, with stone still in his mouth, will have earned the right to train with the warriors. The boys look at each other, sizing up the competition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? What are you waiting for?! And off they run. They knock each other down, punching the other's stomachs, each trying to force the other to expel their stones. One or two succeed. Most of the remaining boys run for the trail that winds high into the mountains. But a few head right for the sheer cliff face. Conan follows the ones headed to the cliff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when the Cimmerian boys climb, it is a sight to behold. They find cracks we can barely see and scale the smooth rock face as though it were a ladder. The hulking teen reaches for the same handhold as Conan, trying to knock him off. Conan swings with one hand and finds another path. In moments he is ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan is in the lead as he crests the cliff top, the bigger boys right behind him. They race through the forest, heading uphill -- When Conan spots movement ahead. He pauses -- 5. And the largest teen elbows past Conan, into the lead. The boy runs two paces more and suddenly flies off his feet, an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lodged squarely in his forehead. All the boys stop. Out of the dense forest come
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Covered with fearsome war paint and armed with dual hand axes, the rotting heads of their enemies are slung at their waist. The boys spit out the rocks in their mouths and YELL. They turn and run in the opposite direction. Only Conan doesn't move, even as another boy pulls at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan! Run! But Conan simply pulls the axe from his large boy's skull. He turns to face the Picts, his eyes burning. The Picts LAUGH and CHARGE CONAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corin arrives with Uran and other armed CIMMERIAN WARRIORS. They get a brief glimpse of a single PICT, escaping in the other direction. One of the Cimmerians takes off in pursuit. Corin desperately searches for his son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan? Conan?! Conan steps forward from out of a thicket, his body covered in Pict blood. Three PICTS lie massacred, the bodies hacked to pieces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done, boy? Conan walks past the other stunned Cimmerians, up to his father. Conan SPITS OUT the bloody stone from his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They killed one. I killed three. I am a warrior now. Uran and the other Cimmerian men exchange worried glances. Looking at the carved up bodies of the Picts, they are aghast. Conan looks confused. Why aren't they happy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A warrior? What you have done a jackal would do. Never a warrior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They would have done the same -- CORIN As I said, jackals. (TO URAN) He is not ready. I will forge him myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan is tested under Corin's watchful eye: - Forced to sleep in the snow, while his father keeps warm inside. - A heavy boulder on his shoulder blades while he balances on wet river rocks. - Climbing a cliff face, his bare hands leaving blood behind on the jagged rocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flames reflect in the blue eyes of Conan as he works the bellows of the forge. Sparks buzz like angry fireflies as he stokes the blaze. Corin sharpens a sword, perfecting it. Conan cannot take his eyes off it, stepping away from the bellows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stoke your fire, boy. Conan slams the bellows closed, anger rising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Stoke your fire, chop your wood." I have slept where wolves dare not. I have balanced a thousand river stones. When will you teach me the sword? Corin stares his son in the eyes. Judging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think you're ready? Then tell me: what is a sword's purpose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To slay ones enemies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. That is what it does. Its purpose is why you use it. He tosses Conan two lumps of ore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, which makes the best sword? Conan takes the two lumps, testing them. He hands his father back one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stronger ore, eh? Then we shall make a sword of it, and tomorrow you will show me what brute strength yields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a setting sun silhouetting the two, Conan attacks Corin. Conan attacks with fury. Corin defends with grace. Until the boy overextends and Corin slashes down a counterattack that
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Corin simply turns and walks away, leaving Conan to puzzle what happened. Corin lowers his sword and walks away, leaving Conan to puzzle what happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan works the bellows, putting his back into it. Corin places both ores in the furnace where they begin to melt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did it break?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it had no life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sparks fly as Corin pounds on the glowing edge of the sword with hammer. Corin nods at Conan, who sprinkles the glowing blade with ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) The strongest blade isn't made of the hardest steel, boy. The hardest ore is what a man will die for. It is strong and unyielding. It neither cowers nor concedes. But without the softer ore, it can be shattered like glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steam rises as Corin lowers the blade into a freezing slack tub, only to place it right back into the flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The softer ore is what a man lives for. It is flexible and lasting. It survives, even against the greatest of foes. But too much of the soft ore, the blade will not cut deep enough when it must.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corin fashions the blade's hilt, engraving the guard and pommel. It is a work of art.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sword must be tempered, the two ores united through fire and ice. Through its suffering the sword comes to hold both life and death. Corin hands Conan the sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now tell me, what is this sword's purpose? Conan furrows his brow, trying to puzzle the answer. He can't. Corin's disappointment shows. He takes the sword from Conan's hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one is not ready yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Blood rushes to Conan's face but he says nothing. He rushes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frustrated, Conan slashes through a field of reeds, cutting everything within reach of him, expending his rage. Behind him something moves in the forest. We catch just a glimpse of the PICT, the same one that escaped Conan in the earlier scene. Conan's instincts cause him to spin around -- but then there's nothing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Built into the side of a huge tree, fifty feet up, this wooden structure houses two CIMMERIAN SENTRIES. A BIRD CRIES in the woods, causing one of the sentries to investigate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He suddenly stands up straight, unmoving. The one still sitting in the structure notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See something? The standing sentry falls backwards, revealing an ARROW piercing his right eye. Shocked, the remaining sentry reaches for the WARNING HORN mounted on the wall. But as he reaches for it, his shadow becomes three dimensional, MORPHING into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thin, feral humanoid, bodies covered in tattoos, from the deepest jungles of Zingara. The scout lashes out with his black sword and cuts straight across the sentry's throat. This Shadow Scout's name is REMO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remo exits and stares down at CHEREN, a BLIND ARCHER clad in lamellar armor and a conical sedge hat. Cheren has an arrow notched and ready, but somehow he knows not to fire. Cheren lowers his bow and lets out a BIRD WHISTLE -- 10. And the forest comes alive. The forces are an odd combination; massive KUSHITE TRIBESMEN, dark-skinned savages from the savannahs of Kush, and a LEGION OF AQUILONIAN MERCENARIES, heavily armored knights drawn from the cities of Aquilonia. Their leaders, respectively, are the six foot-five Kushite chief UKAFA, gold-toothed, his body painted for battle, and the handsome, silver-armored Aquilonian LUCIUS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the last of their guard towers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this sneaking around for a lowly tribe of barbarians.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) This lowly tribe of barbarians have buried every warrior ever to set foot on this land, Lucius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a warlord atop a black horse, rides through the fog-shrouded trees. He bears a nomadic visage, with tanned skin and almond-shaped eyes. While his voice is calm, his eyes burn with malice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is only because they have never faced my legion. Khalar regards Lucius with amusement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then show us. But should you fail, remember the plan. Lucius scowls as he delivers a bow to Khalar Singh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corin walks out of the forge, looking around for Conan. Various other Cimmerians go about the daily routine, but Conan is nowhere to be seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Corin looks to the ridge above the village, noticing a thick fog creeping in. The fog curls and eddies, something is out there. Suddenly, Lucius and his legion of silver-armored warriors burst out of the fog, attacking with speed and strength. But the Cimmerians are hardly caught flat footed. In seconds they are armed, and they counter the charge with a furious charge of their own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Sword and bone collide as the two enemy fronts smash into each other. And the battle devolves into one-on-ones -- Where the barbarians have the upper hand. Uran and Corin lead the main push of battle-frenzied barbarians as they swing their huge broadswords, extending their reach advantage over the Aquilonian's shorter weapons. And quickly, the Aquilonian's numbers are cut in half. Corin squares off against Lucius himself. Lucius is sweating. Worried. It wasn't supposed to be this hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Retreat! As a unit, the Aquilonians race back into the woods. In seconds, the Cimmerians give chase in wild pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Hold your ground! But it's too late, nearly half the Cimmerian warriors are gone on the chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucius and the Aquilonians race up to a sheer cliff face. Nowhere left to run. They turn to see the Cimmerians gathering in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death is in the air, invaders. Can you taste it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indeed. I savor it. Uran notices something is wrong. His eyes go skyward. Atop the cliff stand Cheren and a dozen more of his blind archers, bows at the ready with FLAMING ARROWS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They let the arrows fly, streaking balls of flame heading right for the Cimmerians. But they do not hit them. They hit the tree trunks beside them. And for a moment, the Cimmerians look relieved, until they notice small bags of a black substance tied to the arrows. The flames lick at the substance -- KABOOM! The forest erupts into flames as the Cimmerian warriors are burned alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan spins, started by the sound of the explosion. He sees flames rising above the treetops beyond. He races back home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corin sees the flames in the distance as well. Suddenly, Ukafa and his Kushite warriors erupt out of the forest. Armed with fearsome barbed spears they charge the remaining Cimmerians, savage against savage. But the Kushites are not alone. From behind the Cimmerians comes, AKHUN, a massive four hundred pounds of flesh, wearing loops of chains like armor, leads his turbaned TURANIAN HORSEMEN into the village. The Cimmerian WOMEN arm themselves, but the Horsemen attack with NINE TAILED WHIPS pulling their swords from their hands and dragging them to the ground. The Horsemen quickly gather up the women while Ukafa and his men keep the Cimmerian warriors all too occupied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan rushes through a river, now tinged red with blood, and reaches the far end of the village. Huts burn, women are chained, only a handful of Cimmerians still stand. Lucius and his Aquilonian mercenaries are helping the Spearmen slay the wounded. Conan grabs a fallen sword and rushes for the nearest Aquilonian and RUNS HIM THROUGH. A ZINGARAN spots him and rushes him with his spear. Conan readies himself for the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . When the Zingaran loses his head, lopped off by Corin's blade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come. Corin, sporting a deep gash to his abdomen, pulls a reluctant Conan from the battle, back toward the forge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The flames of the forge still burn as Corin pushes Conan into the room. He bolts the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we need more weapons? Corin drops his sword, then struggles to lift a heavy grating in the dirt floor. Beneath it a trough of cooling water leads under the hut and away from the village.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go. There is a hunting lodge in the North Pass with provisions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I will fight! Corin grabs Conan by his tunic, pulling him up to his face. Corin's eyes are half-crazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fight is over, but yours has just begun. You wanted to be a warrior of the tribe, Conan--now you must be its last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father, I am not afraid to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Make your death have purpose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Something slams at the door. It does not budge. Again,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A shadow appears under the door, sliding into the forge, and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the form of Remo. Remo quickly slides away the bolt.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- THROW HIM IN THE FIERY FORGE

direction.raw_text: . In rush enter Lucius and Ukafa. Corin and Conan face their attackers, fighting in close quarters. Lucius rushes at Conan, only for Conan to duck under his attack and -- THROW HIM IN THE FIERY FORGE. Lucius SCREAMS in agony, rising up to reveal half of his formerly handsome face burned to a crisp. Corin fights Ukafa to a standstill, until Remo emerges from the shadows behind him and drives a short sword into his back. Corin falls to his knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Lucius delivers a massive backhand, sending Conan flying backwards -- and demolishing one of the Forge's main support beams. Half of the forge comes crashing down on top of Conan, pinning his bleeding form to the ground, just a few feet from his fallen father. Enraged, Lucius turns his anger to Corin, raising his sword to deliver the killing blow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I said I wanted a word with him. Lucius stays his hand as Khalar Singh steps into the forge. Beside him stands the PICT who escaped from Conan earlier, grinning from ear to ear. Khalar Singh hands him a bag of gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As promised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (strange dialect -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their heads. You promised me their heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All you wish, once we are gone. The Pict nods and heads off, drawing his knife. Khalar Singh stares down at Corin, sizing him up. Corin lifts up into a sitting position, back to the forge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I take no pleasure in this day, barbarian. Your people are fierce warriors, deserving of every story told of them. But now you must choose the story for yourself. I am Khalar Singh. My army is handpicked from the best Hyboria. My second, Ukafa, and his Kushite horde. Remo and his Shadow Scouts from the jungles of Zingara. And countless others. They all had a day like this one. They all chose a way forward. Into the forge walks Cherin and Akhun. The lieutenants stand behind Corin, eyeing Corin with malice. Corin catches a glimpse of Conan, buried but staring back at him, unable to move. Corin quickly turns away, careful not to give his son away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seek neither gold nor steel, but flesh and blood. The last of a royal line that goes back three thousand years. Corin LAUGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Royalty in Cimmeria? Never. Each man is free here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I seek a woman. Khalar looks outside the door of the forge. The Cimmerians women are being herded by the slavers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A queen in hiding. Point her out and you'll spare the lives of your own. Perhaps even your wife?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife was killed, long ago, by swine such as you. Khalar nods, understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then our stories began in the same place, Cimmerian. I too lost my wife to marauders. How many men, in how many lands have suffered so? The only answer is power, strength unfettered, the kind of which can unite all Hyboria under a single crown. That is the legacy I seek. Will you join me? It's a powerful, convincing speech. But Corin holds his tongue, unmoved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well. Then death will be your story. Your men will die. And your women too, when I am done with them. None will survive to carry your name forth, and over time, even your enemies will forget you ever were. You will be wiped from the pages of history. (to his men) Take your blood, but leave the kill. One by one, the lieutenants beat and stab Corin, taking pleasure in his pain. Conan struggles, trying to move, to yell, to do anything other than lie there. But a huge timber lies upon his back, pinning him to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fariq! Come! Entering the wrecked forge is FARIQ, the six year old son to Khalar Singh. He stares at Corin's bleeding form with the dispassion of a sociopath. Khalar picks up THE SWORD Corin and Conan had forged together, the one Corin took away. He admires it, then hands it to his son. He keeps a hand on it as it is too heavy for his son to lift alone. He instructs his son as if teaching him multiplication.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before you lies our enemy. His tribe waits for him in the beyond. What would you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would cut out his eyes, father, so that he will not find them. So he will wander the afterlife forever. Khalar smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me your strength, Fariq. Without it, you will never rule. With it, you will never be forgotten. Fariq DRIVES THE SWORD INTO CORIN'S EYE. Corin doesn't make a sound. Once Fariq has ripped out Corin's eyes, Khalar runs Corin through.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DRIVES THE SWORD INTO CORIN'S EYE

direction.raw_text: You have your desire. Death has found you. Corin spits out his last words, also meant for Conan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soon -- it comes for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan glimpses around the faces of Khalar and his men, each image seared into his memory as if ablaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burn this place. It no longer exists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The forge is lit afire from a half dozen torches, thrown onto its roof and inside its windows. Khalar and the other watch as the building roars into flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoke fills the air. Conan struggles, still unable to move. He COUGHS, dying. But then the fire collapses more of the forge, and the falling beams shatter the one that pins Conan to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Slowly, painfully, Conan drags himself into the cooling trough that runs beneath the hut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan exits the forge only to see the entire village burning. The bodies of everyone he has ever known litter the landscape. Nothing stirs. Until he hears a strange CHOPPING SOUND.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan spots the Pict, who is decapitating a dead Cimmerian warrior, adding to the collection of heads at his tattooed waist. The Pict doesn't notice as Conan slips up behind him, then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As the wide-eyed Pict dies, Conan takes the sword and CUTS A NOTCH into his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where there was once a single notch, there are now FIVE such notches, on a much broader arm that struggles to pin another powerful looking arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A raucous bar on the Argossean waterfront. Out the window we see a port lined with Shemish galleys and junks from Kush. The bar is filled with the hearty sailors and merchants of those ships, and those who desire to part them from their hard-earned money; Zamoran thieves, Hyborean mercenaries and Brythunian whores. Most of them watch the arm wrestling match taking place at the back of the bar. A pair of CITY GUARDS, short swords sheathed at their sides, enter the bar and are immediately summoned over by the harried BARKEEP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's back there. The barkeep motion to the arm wrestlers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this one done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he done?! What hasn't he done? He's bedded six of my whores and finished off three casks of mead--and he hasn't paid so much as a silver piece for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So have your men deal with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did. Behind the bar, six men each hold down two HULKING MEN YELLING in agony as their horribly broken arms are snapped back into place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like a real problem. Too bad we have other places to be right now. The Barkeep shakes his head, knowing the routine. He slips a pair of silver pieces into the soldier's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just get that behemoth out of here. The two City Guards make their way to the back of the bar. His back to them, the DRUNKEN MAN they're after struggles to pin his opponent, cobras beneath each of their wrists, ready to strike at the loser. A pair of voluptuous WHORES watch, caressing the Drunken Man's sinewy back. The Drunken Man YELLS in fury as he SLAMS the other man's hand down upon the cobra, which immediately bites its prey. As the soldiers arrive, the drunken victor throws his tankard of ale at the Barkeep, who's now back behind the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piss-water! You'll serve my friends and I your best, barman, or you'll taste steel!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time to leave, northerner. The Drunken Man turns as the City Guard puts a hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gangly fifteen year old boy has grown into a powerfully built man, broad-shouldered with sun browned skin lined with battle scars. Only the piercing blue eyes and square cut black mane remain from the boy we last saw. Conan stands to his full height, looming over the smaller City Guards, who instinctively take a step back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, my small friends. It's time to die. Now-- Conan sways. The room spins. He falls on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's first -- CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan, unconscious, is dragged down the street by the two City Guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the gods, he's as heavy as a horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even a dead horse smells better than this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The City Guards drag Conan into a broad prison yard. Many of the INMATES are shackled together, hacking with picks at the rock walls on their work detail. Those in no condition to break rock are left in their own filth to rot. Some are even dead already, the rats gnawing at the remains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two City Guards drag Conan into the guardhouse, where a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits eating his dinner. The Lieutenant doesn't even bother to look up from his meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the charge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Public drunkenness. Another damn hill ape who can't handle his liquor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that so, boy? How do you plead? Conan yawns in response. One of the City Guards slaps Conan, hard, across the face. Conan slowly opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the Captain of the Guard?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come from down the hall, past a locked door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the cells, interrogating a prisoner. And you'll get the same if you don't answer. You're accused of public drunkenness. How do you plead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In truth, I've been guilty of much. Jewels stolen from the crowns of kings, men's heads split in battle for the price of a night's drink. But through that I've searched and waited and hunted my prey. Suddenly Conan shifts upright, looking more sober than he did a moment ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But drink? Haven't had a drop all night. The guards holding Conan up by his arms, suddenly find those arms wrapped around their heads. Twist, twist. SNAP. SNAP. He breaks both their necks in an instant. The Lieutenant is horrified. He goes for his sword. Conan bats it out of his hand, slamming his head against the back wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The key to the cells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have it. There's a guard inside the door. Only he can open it. Conan picks up the Lieutenant's sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't kill me! He'll only open the door for me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Conan delivers a blow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits on a stool next to a heavy metal door. Behind him, the CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD beats a chained ONE-EYED PRISONER to a pulpy mess. There's a KNOCK at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Need to see the Captain. The Guard exhales, frustrated. He stands up, getting his keys out. He stops. Opens the small EYEHOLE to see into the other room. The Lieutenant stares back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, fine. He opens the door-- Only to see Conan standing there, holding the decapitated head of the Lieutenant. The shocked Guard goes for his sword. Conan swings the Lieutenant's head, smashing it into the Guard's jaw and putting him down for the count. That's when the Captain of the Guard turns around. And WE RECOGNIZE HIM! He's LUCIUS, the disfigured Aquilionian who was one of Khalar Singh's lieutenants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . From around a corner come five more Guards, drawing their weapons. Lucius draws his as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've made a huge mistake, ape. You'll never make it out of this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came for you, Lucius. Lucius nods to the guards, who advance on Conan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talk as though you know me, ape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. And I am no ape. I am Cimmerian. As recognition crosses Lucius' face, Conan springs into action. He KICKS the table at the men, sending the knives and other torture implements flying right into the first guard. The second guard tries leaping over the falling table. Conan just grabs him in midair and throws him even faster into the iron bands of the prisoner cells. Lucius lunges at Conan, Conan steps in on him, grabbing his sword hand. In a show of strength, he twists Lucius' own sword until points down at the floor, then THRUSTS IT THROUGH LUCIUS' FOOT AND DEEP INTO THE WOOD FLOOR BELOW. Lucius BELLOWS in pain, pinned to the spot. The next three Guards rush forward, forcing Conan to deal with three weapons attacks at once. The first to strike swings a mace and chain that wraps around Conan's sword and he tries to yank it free from Conan's grip. Instead, Conan pulls him in a wide circle, sending him flying into a wall-mounted torch. The guard burns like dry kindling. The second to strike hits Conan on his sword hand, carving a deep gash and causing him to drop his sword. Conan turns to face him, eyes filled with rage. The guard's face goes pale. Conan head butts him with all his might and the guard goes down, bleeding from mouth, nose and ears.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THRUSTS IT THROUGH LUCIUS' FOOT AND DEEP INTO THE WOOD FLOOR BELOW

direction.raw_text: . However, the last Guard is upon Conan before he can react. The powerful soldier uses the shaft of his poleax to lift Conan off his feet and back against the far wall, pinned by the neck. Conan struggles to breathe, the polearm shaft driving his throat into the wall. The thickness of the Cimmerian's neck gives him time to reach into his bracer, pulling out a hidden knife which he buries into the Guardsman's eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucius SCREAMS in pain as Conan pours water on the burning guard, and lifts the table back onto its legs. Then he pulls the sword out of the floor, a thick plume of blood rising out of Lucius' now liberated foot. Conan takes Lucius' face and smashes it against the table. Lucius looks, aghast, as Conan takes his injured hand and places it over the torch flame, searing the wound closed. The Cimmerian never even bats an eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? Who are you? Conan turns his face to the burnt side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the one who made you pretty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impossible! You're dead! Conan shows Lucius the FIVE SCARS running down his forearm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I am death. And I came a long way for you. Conan lifts the sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait!! Wait!! (CONAN PAUSES) I can tell you where the rest are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The end of the earth. You kill me, and you'll never find them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you offering?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who do you think? All of them. Ukafa, Remo, Cheren, Akhun -- and Khalar Singh himself. But you have to swear you won't kill me. Conan thinks about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have my word. You tell me where I will find Khalar Singh, and I will not kill you. Conan lets Lucius go. Lucius hobbles to his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is in a city called on the edge of the Eastern Sea. On the edge of Hyboria. Khor Khalba. Conan looks him in his eyes, sizing him up. He likes what he sees. In a flash, Conan grabs Lucius' head again, yanking it back, exposing his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gave your word! Conan rips a SMALL KEY from a large keyring. He drops it in Lucius' throat. The big man chokes instantly. A second later, Conan pours ale from a flagon down his throat as well. Lucius swallows the key, gasping for breath as Conan releases him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toasting, to our deal. Conan swings his sword and cuts the One Eyed Prisoner from the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go. You are free. One-Eye looks at his wrists and ankles, still hobbled by shackles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't get far like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Conan hands him a fallen Guardsmen's sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The key to your shackles sits in the Captain's gut. Happy hunting. The One-Eyed Prisoner grins with malice. As he closes in on the terrified Lucius, Conan heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbarian! I had your word! You said you would spare my life!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I said I wouldn't kill you. We hear Lucius SCREAMS OF PAIN as Conan walks out into the night, cutting another notch into his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks older. Worn. He squints as he stares into a howling sandstorm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: trudges through the deep sand to reach him. The sandstorm is so blinding we don't see him until he is less than five feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar Singh, we've lost half our cavalry legion, and still Fariq presses on! We must turn back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says the Queen is here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads us in circles. He knows nothing of leading an army -- KHALAR SINGH Take care, Ukafa. You hold a special place in my kingdom, but blood you are not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My apologies, Khalar Singh. I am simply concerned for your army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I would gladly sacrifice every last man to get my hands on the Queen. And in that respect, Fariq has my confidence. He knows more of the legends of Acheron than anyone. Suddenly, two forms race at them from the blinding sand. REMO and FARIQ. No longer a child, Fariq is now a man in his twenties, but he is hardly the strong warrior his father is. His frame is slight, his eyes beady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father, they are here! The hidden oasis, just as it was written. Khalar Singh looks to Remo for confirmation. The misshapen and shadowy Remo nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remo and Fariq lead Khalar and Ukafa into a natural tunnel carved out of rock. Inside, the sandstorm no longer rages. And on the other side of the tunnel -- EXT. OASIS - CONTINUOUS A protected rock oasis, heavy vegetation crawling up the encircling cliff walls, herds of sheep grazing on fields of grass. At its far end, beyond a deep blue pond, lies a Greek- influenced monastery and several tiled-roof, mud-brick houses. And moving between the pools are MEN and WOMEN going about their simple chores. They wear long flowing white linen robes and turbans. The air and sand are perfectly still within the perimeter of the oasis. But beyond it, the sandstorm rages all around, sand hurled violently hundreds of feet into the air, swirling around the oasis as though it were the eye of some mystical hurricane, protected by an unseen force. A row of robed YOUNG WOMEN kneel in front of one of the reflecting pools, quietly reading from prayer books and softly striking their right breast with a left hands wrapped in thorns. One girl, ILIRA, mischievously taps the shoulder of the girl next to her with her thorn. The girl, TAMARA, squeals in pain, angry her prayer was interrupted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ilira is the fun-loving dilettante of the relationship. Tamara the studious good girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it! I'm trying to pray!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm bored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then hit yourself. Tamara hits Ilira back with her thorn. Ilira SQUEALS, then hits a grinning Tamara back. Tamara grabs her, but as they
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Is that how one shows penitence? Both girls instantly stop as FASSIR appears behind them. Fassir is an elder monk and leader of the monastery. He shakes his head, both out of fondness and disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expect more from a queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Fassir. I just tire of saying the same prayer every day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you should be able to translate it from its original Acheronian. Ilira's face scrunches, unsure. Tamara steps in to help Ilira save face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course she can. She even taught it to me. "Never again."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never again will we stand by as darkness consumes the world. Never again will innocents suffer for others' power. Never again will the Queen suffer so Acheron may rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good, Tamara. You must have taught her very well indeed, Ilira. A smile on Fassir's face confirms he knows the truth. Suddenly, the monastery's BELL RINGS OUT. A moment later, a temple EXPLODES in flames. Pouring out from the swirling sands come Khalar Singh's army. Cheren and his archers stand atop Khalar's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A massive siege engine atop which CHEREN and his archers fire
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The arrows arc down and explode as they impact the tiled roofs. Sitting at the highest point of the Man Of War, Khalar Singh likes what he sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The monks scatter in every direction, but wherever they turn, more troops burst out of the swirling sand. A small handful of armed MONKS display acrobatic martial arts prowess as they battle with Khalar's heavily armed forces, but they are vastly outnumbered. Fassir grabs Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Queen must not be captured. Take her out the North Gate. Quickly! Tamara grabs Ilira and pulls her through the flaming battleground. Zingaran warriors cut down the monks while Turanian horsemen concentrate on the women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't leave them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you are caught, everything we live for is lost!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A whip encircles Ilira's waist. A massive TURANIAN pulls her to him. Tamara grabs the whip, pulling Ilira the other way. But she is no match for the huge slaver. He yanks on the whip pulling both of them to him -- 30. Only then does he notice Tamara's unsheathed knife which she plunges into his throat. She frees Ilira and they run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thin alleyway at the rear of the monastery, leading away from the din of battle, towards a rear gate of the oasis. Tamara and Ilira run for the gate, only for the shadows of the alleyway to move and shift -- REMO and three of his shadow scouts. They advance on the women, drawing dark shortswords.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No swords. Khalar needs them alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to know. Tamara lunges for the nearest shadow scout with her knife, but when she strikes, she hits nothing but shadow. It reforms behind her and grabs her. Another grabs Ilira. Tamara launches her body into the air, executing a backflip that puts her behind the shadow scout. A quick knife strike and he goes down. And with one continuous motion, she vaults over the shadow scout holding Tamara, cutting his throat as well. Remo and the remaining scout give chase, blending in and out of shadows. But each time they strike, Tamara defends Ilira. They near the far end of the alleyway, the North gate looming ahead with the desert beyond. Remo blends into another shadow -- EXT. MAN OF WAR - CONTINUOUS Remo materializes out of a shadow atop the Man Of War, next to Cheren, the archer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The north gate. Destroy it. Cheren and the other archers turn their fire to the gate at the end of the passage. They fire a volley of fiery arrows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara and Ilira run for the whirling sands just ahead -- when the flaming arrows land before them. Ilira hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll die!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll die if we stay! She locks eyes with Ilira, who nods. Together they run right for the arrows. But at the last minute, Ilira falters. She falls to the ground. Tamara turns to see Ilira lying in the gateway a moment too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: causing a cave in that closes the gateway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara falls to the sand as the gate collapses behind her. She looks back, only to see that Ilira didn't make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar Singh stares at the cloud of destruction at the north tunnel. There, one form hurries into the swirling sandstorm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was guarding that gate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was I, Lord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take four legions. Hunt her. Before I hunt you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara stumbles through a stretch of barren wasteland, the plumes of the oasis' sandstorm now off in the distance behind her. The sun mercilessly beats down upon her face, her lips are already chapped. She falls to her knees, unable to go on. She looks up, as the heat streams off the desert floor, creating a swirling mirage. Through which the silhouette of a rider appears, followed by others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The horse-drawn carts of the caravan are lined with iron bars, and behind the bars are a bevy of young women, mostly looking worse for wear. The HEAD SLAVER rides ahead, and walks up to the heap of white cloth that is Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water -- please -- He lifts her barely conscious head, eyeing her features, a greasy paw examining her body. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gods are good. (to the other slavers) Chain this one in my cage. She'll be the prize of the auction in Khor Kalba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Man of War dominates the center of the oasis, its torches illuminating the scene before it. Akhun and the Turanians hold chains connected to the twenty women monks, kneeling, with their wrists chained to their neck collars. In front of them kneels Fassir, beaten and bloodied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Khalar Singh, Fariq, and Ukafa step down from the Man of War. Fariq carries with him a large iron box with ornate carvings on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All these years searching the ends of the earth. And here you are. Just a two day ride from Khor Kalba. I can scarcely believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Acheronian, to monks) Say nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Say nothing. Maybe he doesn't know who we are. Maybe he's not looking for the Queen. Several of the women look up at him, shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, my brethren, you have been lied to all your lives. Told you must hide yourselves, told you were alone. I want you to look at me, and see me for what I am. A brother. A friend. I have come not to hurt you, but liberate you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You come for your own dark purposes, to raise Acheron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I come to resurrect the greatest empire Hyboria has ever known.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An empire of evil, soaked in blood sacrifice and the blackest of magic. Khalar Singh becomes infuriated, eyes blazing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you hidden from the world so long that you cannot to see? Blood, magic, death: it is everywhere. Acheron is no different than any other kingdom, but for its glory. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And in place of that glory, you offer shame? I knew shame, but that was before I was shown my true lineage. Khalar draws closer to the women, looking them each in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was but a child, raiders destroyed my village, cut our fathers to ribbons, and burned our women as sacrifice to foreign gods. Those few who survived, we ran for our lives, chased into caves at the edge of the Eastern Sea, left with nothing to live for. But then we discovered it. Acheron. The temple that spawned an empire. We learned that we were not broken goat- herders on a desolate coastline. We were the sons and daughters of kings. (stares in Ilira's eyes) And queens. He motions to Fariq, who brings the iron box forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For thirty years I have searched for you. In that time I built both an army and empire, but they are nothing compared to what we can create together. We can raise Acheron again. Never again will we hide like rats. Never again will we watch as our loved ones are slaughtered. I call forth the Queen. Stand and join me, and this day will have a joyous end. No one moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would have all the world suffer, as you have suffered. We will die before we help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. You will. He nods to his son. He paces in front of the female monks, the box in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The caves beneath Khor Khalba contain all manner of creature, many -- altered -- by centuries of blood magic. But one, in particular, has developed a special connection to the blood. A thirst. It is said that only the Queen of Acheron itself can resist its embrace. He stops, one woman away from Ilira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what say you? Will you be the lucky one, or will you tell me who is? A tear falls down her face, but she stays silent. There's the sound of SLITHERING as Fariq opens the box. She stares down inside the box -- AND SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She awakens to the SCREAMING of a whipped SLAVE GIRL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara's eyes are met by a dozen others, SLAVES of every color, chained together with her in a CAGED WAGON. The SLAVE TRADER swings his whip twice more, hitting the cowering women in the cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wake up, slags! Smile! A new owner approaches! Tamara makes eye contact with the Slave Trader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me go. I promise you'll be rewarded. The Trader just laughs, leering at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I would sample that reward, fair one, but you wear white. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, have the stars aligned and delivered a virgin slave into my care? He eyes her lasciviously. Tamara turns away and does not answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No matter. I'll know soon enough. (TURNS AWAY) Good day, sir! A lone rider in a desolate land. The perfect customer for what I sell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rides out of the sun, his massive form silhouetted by the bright desert sky. He stares at the slave wagons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, master! Your gold can free me from this hole! I can bring you
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Slave Trader immediately WHIPS her, incensed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence whore! The Slaver goes to whip her again, but before the blow can fall, Conan grabs his arm. The Slave Trader looks furious, but Conan's size holds him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khor Kalba. Which way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the road to Khor Kalba. Ahead. Past the Great Wall. The Slaver nods to the east and Conan releases his arm. The Slaver continues whipping the slave. Conan just rides on - - not his problem. But as Conan passes Tamara, for a brief moment their eyes meet. Something about her. Conan stares a moment, then spurs his horse on. Just then, the ground around them RUMBLES. Horses rear, the women SCREAM. Conan turns and looks up. His eyes go wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Coming thundering down the hills on all sides. The SLAVERS see them a moment to late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Several of the horses and carts are smashed by the rolling boulders. Conan kicks his horse, trying to outrace the boulders. But when the wagon next to him is hit, its axle spears his horse in its side, and Conan goes down. Pissed, he draws his sword. The Slavers scramble around the broken wagons, in chaos. Only a pair of wagons still stands. One of them holds Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Use your whips on the horses' legs! The Slavers are confused. Then they notice
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: racing down the hill, behind the boulders. As the riders bear down upon the slavers, the Slavers do as they're told, entangling the legs of the first wave of horses, throwing their riders. More than a few riders SNAP their necks as they're driven into the desert floor. The remainder fight hand to hand, and are cut down by either Conan's blade or the slavers' tulwars. But their victory is short lived -- As a SECOND WAVE OF RIDERS comes thundering towards them, before the Slavers can re-establish their perimeter. The riders start cutting the slavers down where they stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan lodges his sword in a still-rolling boulder. As it rolls, it pulls him up on top of it. From this height, Conan launches himself down at the horsemen below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He knocks a rider off his horse, Conan landing square in the saddle. He kicks the horse straight at the other riders. They don't see him coming until it's too late. He cuts them down where they sit. The last remaining CARAVAN DRIVER whips his horse team, trying to pull his wagon out of the fight. Conan spins to see a FLASH of steel and the rider's neck plumes in blood as he's decapitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Which is strange since the cavalry are nowhere near the wagon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The explanation comes as the shadow behind the driver MORPHS into Remo, the spindly Shadow Scout. He takes the reins, stopping the wagon. Conan spots him, recognition in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You! There's a SCREAM. Conan turns to see the other two SHADOW SCOUTS already hacking their way through the slaves on one of the caged wagons. A Shadow Scout gets to Tamara, only to have her FIGHT BACK. Tamara kicks the first Scout in the face, slamming his head into the bars. However, the second one clubs her unconscious from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leaps from his horse, launching his body at Remo. Remo dives and rolls away. Small and misshapen, he is nonetheless very fast. Conan strikes again. Again Remo dodges out of the way. The Shadow Scouts draw swords, but Remo waves them off, speaking in the broken language of a savage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl! Bring her to Khalar! Conan launches an all out attack. Remo leaps over his sword and vaults Conan, landing on his back. He draws his sword, preparing to cut Conan's throat -- When Conan hurls his body backwards, into one of the huge rolling boulders. The impact crushes Remo and he loses his grip. Conan spins to strike again, only to see Remo MELT INTO THE SHADOW OF THE BOULDER. Conan turns his attention towards the other two Shadow Scouts as they drag the unconscious Tamara away.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: MELT INTO THE SHADOW OF THE BOULDER
THEY MELT AWAY INTO HER SHADOW AND DISAPPEAR

direction.raw_text: . Conan mounts one of the cavalry horses and gallops towards the Scouts. They see him coming and let go of Tamara. THEY MELT AWAY INTO HER SHADOW AND DISAPPEAR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dazed, she struggles to her feet. Conan appears beside her, his dagger out. Tamara gasps in fear but Conan only reaches out and breaks the lock on her chains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am nobody. He cuts the bonds on her feet. Tamara rises up, the battle scene revealed to her. Dead bodies of the Slavers and Turanian horsemen lie sprawled in every direction. Tamara takes in the gruesome sight, shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Many died to capture nobody. (motions to his horse) Get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I don't wish to ride with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan rides his horse, Tamara trailing on foot, wrists tethered to Conan's saddle by a long rope. Tamara looks exhausted. They reach a gallery of broken columns, spires of fossilized coral that juts out of the desert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! I want water. Conan just keeps riding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps the slavers took your orders. I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never knew men could be so cruel. Now I wonder if the world is filled with animals such as you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You speak of animals as if they were less than men. But animals don't stab their brothers in the back or steal their mother's only possession. And they never lie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't lied. Conan get off his horse, unties Tamara and gives her a water sack. Tamara greedily drinks down the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well. Give me your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Tamara Amelia Karushan. And you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Conan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan? That's it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What more names do I need? Conan then grabs Tamara around her waist, putting her atop his horse. He then mounts behind her, their bodies close. Conan's mouth is only inches from her ear as he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is only one truth I need from you, Tamara Amelia Karushan. Why does Khalar Singh want you? Tamara looks away, but doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's hope it's for your cooking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A campfire amidst several large boulders, a line of windmills on the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tamara struggles to manage a cooking pot over a blaze. Conan comes over and smells the pot; his face scrunches from the odor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to poison me? Tamara steps back and gets down on her knees, her hands clasped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before we eat, I must pray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crom! What would you pray for? That a bone may not get stuck in your throat? No words nor gods will give you one more moment than fate allows you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you have no faith. And I am sorry for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need no pity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you do. You live in a world that is harsh and short. Where fate is unyielding and hope is a cruel joke. I live in a world with a purpose that guides me, where faith sustains me. Suddenly, Conan KICKS DIRT PAST TAMARA, ONTO THE FIRE. The fire goes out, plunging everything into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you-- Suddenly, there's the sound of FIGHTING. Grunting, blows being interchanged, then a LOUD SNAP AS BONES ARE BROKEN. A moment later, the flames of the fire are stoked up again, revealing Conan standing over the groaning REMO. The other two SHADOW SCOUTS are dead. Tamara instinctively jumps back.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: KICKS DIRT PAST TAMARA, ONTO THE FIRE
LOUD SNAP AS BONES ARE BROKEN

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. His back is broken. He won't be slinking away this time. As Tamara gapes at Remo, Conan simply pulls the cooking pot off the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, let's eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But -- what about him?! Remo GROANS in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I enjoy a little music with my meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SOARING Across steep valleys and up jagged peaks we race into steep and unforgiving mountains. Far off, we hear a pair of thunderous booms, almost like the sound of a heartbeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cresting over a set of peaks, a gorge is revealed below, and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ACHERON - NIGHT - MOVING A city carved out of the purple granite of a mountainous gorge. Hundred-foot towers rise up, their pinnacles crafted to depict ANGRY, GOD-LIKE FACES. As we pass one of the faces, again we hear the sound of a thunderous heartbeat, now closer. THUMP, THUMP. We GLIDE DOWN past hundred foot high pillars of flames, towards the growing sounds of SCREAMING and WAILING. The streets of Acheron are lined with thousands of SLAVES, young and old, chained together, toiling under the lash of their cruel masters, the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Towering over the slaves, the warriors are a fearsome sight. Their armor, crafted from the bones of their defeated enemies, rises to a mask which covers much of their features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Only the red irises of their eyes peer through. That and their pitch black skin. The slaves hobble down the main boulevard, their naked feet splashing in streams of BLOOD which flow from the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up ahead looms a colossal pyramid, surrounded in a semi- circle by five massive statues. As we grow closer the grotesque surface of the pyramid becomes clearer, one hewn from cracked bone and empty sockets. The thunderous heartbeat seems all around us now. THUMP, THUMP. The three hundred foot high edifice is made ENTIRELY OF THOUSANDS OF HUMAN SKULLS. Many of the skulls still drip with blood, pouring down from the pyramid's crest, where stands
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ENTIRELY OF THOUSANDS OF HUMAN SKULLS
IRON SPIKES SHOOT OUT OF THE IRON CROWN PIERCING THE WOMAN'S FOREHEAD, HER SCREAMS ECHOES THROUGHOUT THE CITY

direction.raw_text: Images of snakes gorging themselves on hapless victims are carved in bas relief into the throne's surface. Standing before the throne, surrounded by BLACK ROBED PRIESTS are a man and woman, mere shadows in the silhouette of torches. The HEAD PRIEST and his ACOLYTE approach with TWO CROWNS. One is made of GOLD, the other of IRON. The Gold crown goes on the head of the man. For the woman, the Iron crown is placed on her head. And suddenly, THUMP, THUMP. IRON SPIKES SHOOT OUT OF THE IRON CROWN PIERCING THE WOMAN'S FOREHEAD, HER SCREAMS ECHOES THROUGHOUT THE CITY. Blood streams down the woman's face as she turns toward the torchlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara leaps up, startled. Her face is covered in sweat, her eyes as terrified as the victim from her dream. Nearby we hear screaming of another type. Remo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We pull out of Remo's wide mouth, stuffed with cloth, trying to bellow in uncontrollable agony. A hand comes in and pulls out the cloth. It's Conan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please! Mercy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are more fit to inflict torture than to endure it. Your life is not nailed to your spine as my peoples are. We PULL OUT, revealing that Remo arms are spread-eagle, attached to ropes pulled taught by opposing tree limbs. Conan nudges him with the point of his sword. Remo SCREAMS in agony, then speaks in his savage, broken dialect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! Stop! I know how make you rich! Rich! You hear name Khalar Singh? You have what he want. The girl, yes? Khalar give you anything for her. More!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would he? Remo pauses, not wanting to answer. Conan put the blade back to Remo's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She could be the one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one. The Queen. Conan's mind races, remembering Khalar's words from long ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A queen in hiding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Yes! I sent to find her. Bring her. He wait for me now, at Great Wall. He pay you anything. More!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I should ransom her to your master? Not exactly loyal -- but still, a good idea. Conan pulls out a sheet of handwritten paper from Remo's tunic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll help me deliver it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Torchlight dots the heights of a fifty-foot high stone wall, erected between giant rock formations, an impassable barrier that runs countless miles. The wreckage of old siege equipment dots the hillside before the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An aging catapult looks down upon the wall below. Slowly, it begins to turn. Conan pushes the catapult until it aims towards the Great Wall. We hear MUFFLED SCREAMS, and find Remo tied to a boulder cradled in the catapult. Conan pulls the gag out of Remo's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please! Please! I help you! I do anything you wish! Conan stuffs a parchment in his mouth. He takes out his sword and cuts another NOTCH into his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Die. He then cuts the rope and WHOOSH! The catapult fires tossing Remo and the rock he's tied to high into the night sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Patrolling SOLDIERS are crushed beneath the massive rock as it reduces a section of wall to rubble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stares down at Remo's broken body. Ukafa and Fariq stand beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He brought a message? Ukafa hands him the bloodied parchment. Khalar reads it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gold, for the girl. A ransom, for me to deliver in person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll find them -- and come back with their heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You let the girl escape once, Ukafa. What makes you think you can do better now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found the monastery. It was my understanding that you were in charge of its capture -- Ukafa's anger grows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough! We will take no chances. We will pay this thief what he wants, and more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan returns from the nearby hills, carrying a pair of rabbits he's hunted and skinned. He looks around, surprised not to find Tamara. He hears a yelp from nearby and walks to a dirt path beyond the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's tied up and gagged and she's wormed her way this far, muddying and scraping herself all along the way. She lets out a frustrated grunt as Conan simply picks her back up and carries her back to the outcropping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He pulls the gag from her mouth and drops a skinned rabbit at her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. Eat. Tamara squirms away from the carcass, disgusted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couldn't you at least cook it first?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire draws attention. Conan tears into his rabbit, chewing on the raw meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it bother you, blood on your hands?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only blood on these hands I claimed with my own sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clean hands mean nothing. Kings and Queens claim more lives than I will ever meet, and not a drop is spilled in their presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? I've done no harm to you. I've done no harm to anyone. Conan confronts her, enraged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lie. You are the very reason my people are dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you mad? I never met your people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Khalar Singh has. He destroyed my people, looking for you. Suddenly Tamara understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one who came for us? His name is Khalar Singh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We did not know who sought us, only that we were sought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hid from him. And while you did, others died in your place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we did not hide, countless more would have been killed! You do not know what purpose he has for our queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I do not care, for he will not live to see it bear fruit! Tamara is shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait -- you seek to kill this Khalar? We have the same aim. He takes my queen to Khor Kalba. I have sworn an oath to protect her. I can help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough lies. Conan puts the gag back in her mouth and binds her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan watches the Great Wall silently, absently playing with a DAGGER in his hand as he gauges the many guardposts along the wall. The archers. The barrels of oil. The cavalry. He feels eyes upon him and looks down at Tamara, still bound and gagged, her eyes burning holes in his forehead. Conan pulls out her gag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will keep quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What use is talking? You won't believe a word I speak. I only want to know this -- how will you kill Khalar? You are too big to play the assassin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will be the lure that will draw me close. Then I will scale the wall and cut him down where he stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the archers and cavalry? They will be napping?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They will not be a problem. Tamara thinks about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not good enough. Conan is shocked by her brazen response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I ask?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should you fail, I'll be left without a weapon, helpless in my enemies hands. Let me help, Conan. Conan responds by putting the gag back in her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will not fail. But still Tamara glares at him -- and we can see the hint of Conan's resolve bending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar Singh stands atop the wall, awaiting Conan. Fariq draws close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me take care of this thief, father. He's beneath your notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He killed Remo, likely his cavalry legion as well. Whatever he is, he is more than a mere thief. Then, off in the distance, at the far edge of the desert clearing, two figures step out from amongst the boulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan holds a squirming, but bound Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be still! Conan thrusts Tamara in Khalar's direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling to Khalar) I have what you want! Where's my gold?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar reaches down and lifts a heavy sack of gold coins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Triple your price. Come and claim it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gates open and Khalar strides out into the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stand a hundred feet ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send her to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send the gold. Khalar Singh throws the gold sack. It lands halfway between them. He sends Tamara ahead, her mouth gagged. But the moment Tamara reaches the gold -- From out underneath the sand, FOUR HORSEMEN rise up out of the desert floor. They each bear weighted nets and spiked lances, and they surround Conan.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LOPS OFF THE HORSES FRONT LEGS
TOPPLING HIM, ALONG WITH HIS HORSE
RIGHT THROUGH THE HORSE'S NECK AND THEN THE RIDER'S NECK

direction.raw_text: . The first rider gallops towards Conan who simply LOPS OFF THE HORSES FRONT LEGS. As the beast collapses, Conan crushes the rider's skull with his broadsword. The next two riders attack together, but Conan dodges their nets and rips away one of their spears, only to lodge it into the other rider's chest. He dives at and tackles the first rider, TOPPLING HIM, ALONG WITH HIS HORSE. He snaps the second rider's neck. The last rider comes at Conan, who horizontally slashes RIGHT THROUGH THE HORSE'S NECK AND THEN THE RIDER'S NECK. Both human and animal head tumble to the desert floor. All four riders are dead, in a matter of seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smiles. He's got Tamara by the neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fast. But are you fast enough? Conan's eyes go to the top of the wall, where CHEREN and his archer prepare to fire. Conan rushes forward as the flaming arrows stream toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rip through the air where Conan was, throwing up a huge dust cloud. Conan bursts out of the dust cloud, lunging in an attack. But Khalar Singh is not there. He has withdrawn inside the gates. Baring his teeth, Conan runs at the wall itself. Cheren and the archers let loose another volley at Conan, who evades and strikes away the falling arrows with his sword. Explosions fill the air, but none of them scorch Conan as he
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan hits the base of the wall at full stride, like a mountain lion. Reaching out, he launches himself up, taking half the vertical of the wall in a single leap. Digging his hand into the seam of the wooden beams, he stops only to vault up again, taking the forty foot wall in two upward bounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan leaps upon wall walk, the passageway atop the Great Wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tries to hide his surprise. Even as he draws his sword, Conan takes out the four SOLDIERS in his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have run, while you could. Conan looks at the sword. It strikes a chord in him. IT IS THE SWORD HIS FATHER FORGED! Enraged, Conan charges the slight Fariq. Fariq partially parries the attack. He's obviously well- trained, but he's no match for Conan. The tip of Conan' blade cuts a large gash in Fariq's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fariq! Khalar Singh arrives, grabbing his son by his collar and flinging him away from the barbarian. Fariq struggles to stand, trying in vain to hide his embarrassment. Conan and Khalar Singh size each other up on the narrow wall walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was wondering what it would take for you to stop cowering.
