direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't cowering. I was studying. You're quite gifted with a sword, but it's not from schooling. Your speed and power makes up for a lack of -- finesse. I've seen such fighting before -- Cimmerian. Enraged, Conan charges Khalar Singh. He swings down on Khalar Singh's head, only when the sword reaches it, it finds nothing but air. Khalar is fast.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IT IS THE SWORD HIS FATHER FORGED

direction.raw_text: Cimmerian it is. Now it makes sense. You came for blood, not gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Conan responds by lunging in, swinging his broadsword in a broad arc, with all his might. Even in the small space, Khalar's lateral speed is dizzying. He sidesteps Conan's attack and backhands Conan's face with the flat of his tulwar. Conan's resolve wavers momentarily, knowing Khalar could have just as easily sliced his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your people barely afforded me a challenge. You're little more than beasts. Conan comes at Khalar with twice as much fury, smashing entire posts as he hacks at the warlord, who simply evades the attack. Down the wall walk they move, Conan attacking while Khalar seems complacent enough just to defend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've come a long way, barbarian, only to fail. Khalar ducks Conan's last wild swing and gashes Conan twice, both deeply in his midsection. Khalar then KICKS Conan, sending the Cimmerian slamming onto the rock parapet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Conan lands directly on his back, his sword clattering away from him. Khalar's men back away into a circle. Conan struggles to get on all fours. Khalar KICKS Conan in his shattered chest, lifting Conan off the ground with his might. He follows up with a devastating punch to Conan's face, one which lands like a piledriver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Conan can only bleed as Khalar looms over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So much for vengeance. (to his soldiers) Get me oil -- and a torch. Soldiers quickly bring over a bucket of oil and a lit torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that really the best you could do? Is that as far as you could think ahead? Just rush in and kill me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Behind Khalar Singh, Conan spots Tamara being brought up, her hands bound. Her eyes show an intense fear, but resolve as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Between the bonds she slips down a blade. It's CONAN'S DAGGER. She quickly cuts her bonds. With all the attention focused on Conan, no one is quick enough to stop her as GRABS THE TORCH FROM THE SOLDIER, LIGHTING THE ARROWS IN CHEREN'S QUIVER. Cheren spins around, sees the flames reaching his pitched arrows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!! But it's far too late. Tamara hits the floor, beside Conan.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: GRABS THE TORCH FROM THE SOLDIER, LIGHTING THE ARROWS IN CHEREN'S QUIVER

direction.raw_text: The blast sends parts of Cheren flying in every direction. Ukafa, Fariq, and the wall guards are flattened by the concussion. Khalar Singh, who was standing closer to the explosion, is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The warlord slowly rises, his head pounding from the explosion. He looks up. The entire parapet is on fire. He grits his teeth and climbs the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thick wall of flame rages before Khalar. Conan and Tamara are gone. He looks over the far side of the wall, where two figures on horseback ride off into the distance, Tamara holding Conan atop the horse. Ukafa and Fariq rise and see what Khalar Singh sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ukafa, you will take half our forces North, to the Sea. I will take the rest South.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What of me, father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will return to Khor Kalba. You will feed the women to the beast until you find our Queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will not. I will track the barbarian with you -- Enraged, Khalar Singh grabs him by the back of his head, pulling him in close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I care what you wish?! You want to play warrior? It is not in you. One day you will be king, but warlord, never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can. Let me prove it to you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will not risk your life again. You are my line, my successor. You will not throw away all that I have worked for. A smile creeps up on Ukafa's face, watching Fariq's embarrassment. He withdraws hastily, all eyes on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (without looking at Ukafa) If I find you smiling before you bring me the girl, I will take every tooth I see. Ukafa buries the smile as Khalar turns to the wall of flames left in Conan's wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The flames become the blaze of the forge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) More wood boy! We must test the steel with our fire. Conan, a young boy again, kneels beside the woodpile, pulling
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But when he hands them to his father, he notices his father is covered with sword wounds, cut and bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you waiting for? The fire is dying. Conan turns back to the wood pile. Instead of wood, the pile is full of the bodies of those he recently killed: Lucius, Remo, etc. The young Conan struggles to push the first body onto the forge. Still the fire diminishes. Conan turns and there is no more wood. And no more bodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not enough. I've failed you father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will never be enough, Conan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand -- He spins. Behind him TAMARA stands, a look of sadness on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through suffering, you will learn your purpose, boy. And you have not begun to suffer yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan's eyes pop open. He inhales sharply, gripped by the dream. The room is dark, surrounded by thick draperies. Conan lies on a straw bed with white sheets, soaked through with his sweat. He looks to his wounds, all bandaged. He rises--a bit too fast because he falls back to his bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't move so fast. I bound your wounds as best I could, but I'm no healer. Conan looks over to discover Tamara sitting nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where am I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the Wasp. You told me where it laid, just before you passed out. Though I can't say as I feel much safer here. Conan's response is to rise again, his face contorting in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't embarrass me with thanks, I only saved your life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were -- adequate. Conan pulls aside one of the thick draperies that surround his bed. Behind it lies a staircase, which he ascends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan steps out onto the deck of a sixty-foot djunk, traveling quickly down a wide and powerful river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look what we have here. A hill ape in over his head. Conan spins to see the rough, brightly dressed Zamoran pirate
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaping down from the quarterdeck, his sword out. The other ZAMORAN PIRATES draw near as well. Tamara sees the scene, suddenly uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just wondering what that smell was. (sniffs near Artus) Now I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We take no stowaways. Only paying passengers. You've best be laden with gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's metal you seek, perhaps you'd settle for steel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In a flash Conan's sword lunges forward. CLANG. It meets Artus's, sparking as they collide. Artus LAUGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still fast Artus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fast, deadly, charming, rakishly handsome. (to the pirates) All hail Conan!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All hail Conan! Artus slaps his hand on Conan's back and Conan winces in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, friend. Looks like you've had a rough road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't get easier. Khalar Singh lives. He'll be coming for me and the girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. We're scrapping for a fight these days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one may be more than you wish. I need you to get me close to Khor Kalba. Artus rubs his beard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rest up. We'll get you there. Conan withdraws to his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan collapses on the bed as Tamara follows him inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We go to Khor Kalba?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Conan puts a brawny arm over his tired eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just leave me to sleep. But Tamara doesn't leave, forcing Conan to respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would risk your life for royalty? Why? Tamara pauses, realizing she must trust Conan to gain his help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because she represent freedom, not just ours but all Hyboria's. What do you know of Acheron?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tall tale. Meant to scare children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is no fable. It's my people's history. Acheron was an empire that swallowed all of Hyboria, led by the King and his legion of demon warriors. Unstoppable. Insatiable. Immortal. But still it had one weakness. For the true power of Acheron laid not with its King, but the Queen. Every twenty years, a new queen from the royal line would be coronated with a crown of iron. Spikes would pierce her, slowly drain her precious blood, and through her suffering Acheron would remain invincible. Until one of my ancestors, an Acheronian himself, put a stop to this tyranny. He and others spirited the new Queen away, hiding her from the empire and all those who would raise it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What care I for queens and empires? Conan turns to head back to his bed. Tamara grabs him, incensed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you hear me? This evil faces us all. All of civilization will fall if the army of Acheron is raised again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard. Only I would happily put all of your "civilization" to the torch myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But -- you owe me a debt, you thankless oaf!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My only debt is to my people. And it still lies unpaid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The enormous siege vessel lies before a burning PORT CITY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: crying, grovels on his knees before Khalar and his men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a pirate ship. They left as soon as the girl and the large one boarded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way did they sail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: North. Khalar is surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you certain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, please, I'm telling you the truth! Khalar nods to one of his men, who slits the Sailor's throat. Khalar turns to his FALCONER, with the huge bird of prey on his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send word to Ukafa. They come to him by sea. The Falconer nods and heads off. Khalar looks to his soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find me a warship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship sails like a ghost over black water, the stars lit up impossibly bright. Artus finds Tamara sitting near the bow. He hands her a steaming bowl of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try not to taste it going down would be my advice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've known Conan long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We sailed with him for a while. I would like to say I know the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is a riddle to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, he's that too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have the same goal. Why will he not trust me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would he? He's a stranger in every land he trods. A man with no home, no people, none but the company of ghosts. And he bears the weight of their deaths every moment of every day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is no way to live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't live. I've seen in him great mirth, only to watch it smothered by greater melancholy. He owes a blood debt, and he can entertain no other joy, no other cause, until it is fulfilled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And yet you call him friend, and risk death to help him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me tell you something of Conan. He will never lie. He will never break a trust, once given. And he will never, ever give up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a stubborn ass. Artus LAUGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is that, lass. He is that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and his Turanian slavers lead the female monks into a large circular chamber, lit by many torches. Before them lies a PIT, dark and foreboding, with a bamboo grid placed atop it. Fariq enters, an AIDE holding the iron box he used earlier. Fariq has a bandage on his face where Conan struck him, and he looks even more angry and malevolent than before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we stand again. Will the queen reveal herself, or must another innocent suffer? Fariq walks past the row of women, each recoiling. He slaps one. Then another, his rage only building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father, he tires of your charade. He grows impatient. But I have no such haste. I enjoy watching you squirm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fariq passes Ilira, slowing his pace. He closes in on the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a true innocent with terrified eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps you'd like to see the end your sisters faced back at the monastery? Fariq slowly opens the box before her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the darkness of the box slithers a grotesque TENTACLE. The tentacle is severed, but still alive, thirsting for blood. Terrified as she is, the young monk says nothing. Fariq closes the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No? Your fear is not enough yet? Let's try harder. Fariq nods to the slavers, who unchain her from the rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've read all there is to know of mighty Acheron. Why would true Acheronians protect a traitor to their own? You once held the entire world in your grasp, now you hide and cower like pitiful mice. He pushes the girl. She falls to the grid, the sound echoing down into the pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: emits from the darkness. Something comes. The girl looks below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And mice are meant to be swallowed whole. Suddenly, a MASSIVE TENTACLE, ten times the size of the one in the box, comes hurtling up through the grid. It grabs the young monk, its barbs ripping into her, dragging her into the darkness below. Her SCREAMS echo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was in the box could only drink from you one at a time. But the beast of Acheron, it will claim four of you this night. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who will spare the rest and tell me which of you is the queen? Not a single woman moves, resolved. Ilira catches herself, but also stays silent. She looks up to see Fariq staring at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ILIRA'S EYES Her pupils widen in fear as Fariq's cold stare bores into her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I am here, swine. Fariq turns -- only it is another FEMALE MONK that glares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the one you seek. Fariq smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At last. Some bravery. But of course, you wouldn't expect me to take your word, would you? As the Fariq reaches for her--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara awakens with a SCREAM, her body resting against the curved hull of the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!!! Tamara looks around with a panicked look, until she realizes where she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I hope I awoke with less clamor. Their roles reversed, now it is Tamara's turn to see Conan sitting nearby, drinking from a flask of mead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're drinking? You were near death this time yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a better reason to drink? Tamara actually manages to LAUGH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think--I could try some of that? I'm curious of its taste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've never tasted mead? Tamara shrugs, embarrassed. Conan hands her flask. She takes a deep swallow, some spilling out over her cheeks. But she doesn't cough, and smiles brightly afterwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's good. Conan reaches for the flask, but Tamara ignores him, taking another swig. It quickly loosens her tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me ask you something. Once you've killed Khalar and claimed your vengeance, then what? You will be free from your ghosts. What of your future, Conan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no future. It died with my people, as I should have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So your life is penance? For what, for living? And when you too die, what do you believe happens then? Conan just shrugs, taking back the mead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Tamara, her tongue loosened by drink, laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing? I couldn't live without some kind of belief in the world after this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe in the cold of steel, the warmth of flesh. All else is fairy tales.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps. But I still die with faith in my heart, belief in something greater than one's self. What will you die with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Purpose. I die with purpose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara steps out onto the deck, grabbing her pounding head. Her first hangover. She hears a THUMPING sound, followed by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and walks towards the side of the deck. Tamara looks overboard, to the water below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE RIVER IS FILLED WITH BODIES! Bloated, they float in blood red water as flies buzz around them. One of them hits the hull of the boat. THUMP. Tamara blinks, unsure if the vision is real -- but then she's joined by other PIRATES who gape at the bodies below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To stations! To stations! Tamara turns and up ahead spies -- BLACK WARSHIP The larger warship cuts through the water, manned by a legion of rowers. On the deck of the warship, UKAFA and his SPEARMEN stand. The SAILORS get the most out of the billowing black sails. The ship gains fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan exits his room, sees the danger. Artus appears at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think? They have us outnumbered, but we might beat their speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is what they wish. They drive us to another force, approaching from the south.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we fight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We give them what they think they want. (to the Pirates) About ship! Now! The pirates leap into action, tacking and turning the galley with great speed and efficiency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ukafa smiles, his gold teeth shining. The ship's CAPTAIN stands beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're turning to run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. We only need stay close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is turned around now, fleeing. ARCHERS from the Warship fire arrows that barely reach the Galley. The Pirates dodge the few that land on deck. Tamara reaches Conan and Artus. She's worried to say the least.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let us show them why she is called the Wasp. Artus smiles. He was hoping Conan would say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is she called the Wasp?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open astern! Load the stinger! The Pirates rush to the back of the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain stares ahead, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are doing -- something. Sure enough, the stern of the ship begins to part, revealing -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mounted with a barbed harpoon, fifteen feet long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire! They fire the weapon. The harpoon races for the bow of the Warship, a thick rope trailing it. It smashes into the wood, ripping through it like it was paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rip her apart! The Pirates grab the heavy rope and run, pulling the rope, and the harpoon back towards the Wasp. As it's pulled out, the barbs of the harpoon rip a wider hole in the warship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain and crew are in a panic. Men rush to patch the gaping hole in the hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're taking on water!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to port!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Let them fire again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will sink. Ukafa guts the captain with his spear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So be it. (to his spearmen) Get below. Be ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The pirates load the harpoon in the crossbow device a second time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire! It fires, smashing again into the wooden hull of the Warship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INSIDE The harpoon lodges deep inside the hull -- where Ukafa and his spearmen wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now! They rush forward and grab onto the harpoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring her back! Again, the pirates pull the harpoon back out. It falls into the water as they pull on the rope tied to it. They do not notice Ukafa and his dozen spearmen clasping the very same rope as its pulled toward the Galley. Artus looks at the Warship. It's foundering and sinking quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's dead in the water!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes up among the pirates -- And then one PIRATE takes a spear through the chest. All eyes turn to the side of the Wasp, where Ukafa and his men climb aboard. Conan's eyes alight with fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. I was growing weary with boredom. Conan motions to a pair of pirates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hide her below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Spearmen rush to the attack. The pirates spring to the defense of the ship, countering the Spearmen with cutlass and dagger. Ukafa marshals his men as a fierce battle rages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find the girl! The Spearmen quickly make their way to the interior of the galley, throwing the dead bodies of the pirates overboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan grabs the nearby jib, swings over, and plants both feet in the face of one of the spearmen, knocking him over the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sea captain proves dangerous in his own right, grabbing the head of one of the Spearmen and violently pulling it down to the gunwale of the ship, impaling the Spearman's eye on a handspike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The massive warrior shows incredible speed as well, dodging one cutlass attack only to turn the weapon upon another pirate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cimmerian cuts through a Spearman, his gaze focused on Ukafa. Ukafa stares right back as he runs through a pair of pirates. Finally, the two warriors stand only feet apart. The two warriors eye each other with satisfaction. Ukafa's frightening, sharpened gold teeth shine as he smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are each the last of our tribe, Cimmerian. Yours dies this day. Conan responds by lunging forward, swinging his sword in a broad arc. Ukafa is just as quick, stepping back and allowing his spear to block the swing. Ukafa whirls the war spear in great circles, forcing Conan to parry, stepping back beyond the spear's reach. The two powerful warriors trade blows back and forth, neither able to gain the advantage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your head will top my spear today, but know Khalar's pig son will soon share your fate. Ukafa tries to spear Conan through the chest, and Conan decides to drop his sword, grabbing the spear as it passes by him. Conan then pulls on the spear, throwing Ukafa off his balance, towards Conan. Conan then kicks the warrior in the chest, hurtling Ukafa backwards. Now Conan turns the spear on its master. Ukafa, unarmed, is forced to backpedal as Conan thrusts the spear at him. A pair of close misses leaves Ukafa with gashes on his chest and arm, but he manages to knock the spear from Conan's hands. The battle goes to hand-to-hand. It's primal, each of them covered in blood. Ukafa bear hugs Conan, then resorts to using his teeth to bite into Conan's shoulder. Conan YELLS IN PAIN, butting Ukafa's head and knocking him back. Conan falls to the stern of the ship, his back against the harpoon crossbow. Ukafa shakes off the head butt, and sees his spear nearby. He picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now finally, you die. He raises up to hurl the spear through Conan, only to see Conan manning the harpoon, NOW TURNED TO FACE UKAFA. The crossbow fires and the harpoon punches a massive hole through Ukafa, its momentum throwing him off the galley, into the sea beyond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hides inside a small compartment of the ship. She hears
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walking past, then returning. An ARM suddenly reaches in and grabs her. As she's pulled out, Tamara SCREAMS right in Conan's face. He doesn't even flinch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The battle ended, the pirates toss the dead Spearmen into the sea and prepare to make sail again. Meanwhile, Conan lashes his sword to his back, standing by the gunwales with Tamara and Artus, a SMALL DINGHY waiting below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could get you closer. Another half day along the coast -- CONAN I need you head west, to draw off our pursuers. I'll find another path to Khor Kalba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So be it. Swift wind at your backs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan rows away from the galley with powerful strokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you are taking me with you to Khor Kalba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never said that. But I won't leave a virgin onboard a pirate ship, alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but -- who said I was a virgin? Conan just shakes his head as a parting fog reveals a large Colossus head, the fallen remains of an enormous statue, lying agape on the shoreline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan pulls off his jerkin, revealing a torso rippling with muscles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll rest here until morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will I awake alone? Do you intend to leave me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would do you a kindness. Khor Kalba will bring only death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Conan. Artus told me of how you lost your tribe. I too had to watch as my people were taken from me. Conan ignores her, gathering wood for a fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I ask is that you let me travel with you. I too have a purpose. I must get to the queen. I would rather you kill me here, than fail her again. Conan continues collecting, infuriating Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was wrong about you. You are no fearless warrior. Your heart is closed to all but fear -- and hate. Conan draws flint, starting the fire. Only once his task is complete does he answer Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We leave at dawn. I will not break stride for you. Not once. I will get you into Khor Kalba. Beyond that I have my purpose, and you yours. Tamara offers a thankful nod, her anger subsiding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice fire. Does it mean you'll actually cook the meat this time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar looks at the destruction of Ukafa's warship, the bodies filling the water. Khalar spots Ukafa's dead body floating there, harpoon still lodged in his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The ship's CAPTAIN approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pirate ship sailed to the west. Even under full sail it'll be no easy task to overtake her. Just then, a FALCON approaches. The Falconer retrieves it, a parchment tied to its talon. He passes it on to Khalar Singh. Khalar Singh reads it, a smile creeping upon his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fariq has done well. (to the Captain) Head east, back to Khor Kalba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But our chase points the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chase is over. They come to me now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara watches Conan from a distance. He silently stalks prey with nothing more than a knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Its ears listen intently, aware. Suddenly, it bolts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is just as quick, racing through the forest on a intercepting course with the great beast. He leaps over a fallen log, throwing his dagger with a sweep of his arm. The boar goes down, the blade through its jugular. Conan walks up to the struggling beast, showing no satisfaction as he mercifully SNAPS its neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The great haunches of the beast roast over the fire. Conan turns the meat. Behind him, Tamara approaches. She has cleaned herself up, her white robe translucent in light of the fire, her wet hair glistening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Conan can't help but notice her supple skin, her curves. He stops chewing. Tamara notices. Embarrassed, she turns so that he can only see her side. Conan returns to his food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What were the women of your tribe like, Conan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They fought beside the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So they were equals. And your mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She died in battle, even as I was born.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you never knew her. It was the same with me. I've always known being a mother was somehow not my fate. But-- Tamara falters, unsure. But Conan's quiet eases her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said earlier Khor Kalba will bring only death. Were you trying to scare me, or do you really believe our end lies there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't lie. Tamara nods, having heard as much about Conan. She turns back to face him, no longer hiding her body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we don't have much time. Your mother perished too young, but at least she died having known the touch of one who cared. Tamara steps closer to Conan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So -- do you care, Conan? Conan rises to her, his broad form looming over her slight build.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But Conan shows surprising gentleness as he removes her robe and pulls her naked body into his, their mouths meeting in a desperate kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan lies atop Tamara by the fire, their sinewy limbs intertwined, fingers locked together. He thrusts into her, causing her face to contort in pleasure and pain. The fire grows brighter as Tamara rolls on top, undulating as their pace quickens. Tamara CRIES OUT in ecstasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara stares into the fire, her body wrapped around Conan's. She gently caresses the notched scars cut into his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've only ever heard you speak of what you'd die for, Conan. What would you live for? Conan, his eyes closed, keeps them shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you ever tire of talking? Let me rest, woman. Tamara reaches down between Conan's legs. His eyes open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought that may work. Conan growls and pulls himself atop Tamara. Looking down at her face, her hair loose and wild, she's beautiful in the soft glow of the firelight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you clearly now, finally, after all this time. (she kisses him deeply) I would be that which you live for, Conan, if you would have me. You may have faith in nothing, Conan -- but I have faith in you. Conan lowers himself back down upon her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan powers his way to the top of a high ridge, spotting down in the vista below:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surrounded on three sides by the coastline, the stone fortress of Khalar Singh rests on a plateau, overlooking a bustling, tented city below. Conan spots a long CARAVAN of packed camels working their way towards town, driven by DESERT TRADERS from Shem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll slip in, along with those traders. But you'll need a change of clothes, those monks' robes will draw attention. Tamara looks down at her loose-fitting robes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will I wear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The caravan rides up to the walled entrance to the city, guarded by Khalar's troops. Blended in amongst the others, Conan now wears the elaborate head scarf and clothes of Shemish traders, obscuring all but his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara is dressed like a Shemish serving girl, her taut body barely covered by silken drapings. She glares at Conan, miserable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand why I couldn't be dressed as you are. I look like a whore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what better disguise for a monk? Conan tugs on the rope for the camel to move faster. The Camel BRAYS and rears. Conan yanks harder and the camel flies forward, its eyes wide. Conan meets its eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not test me, beast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there not a living thing you can be at peace with? They ride into the city, past the troops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan and Tamara walk through the town's teeming market, a otherworldly bazaar replete with animal sacrifices, veiled faces and not a hint of morality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his form hidden beneath a cloak, spots Conan and Tamara as they enter, and begins to follow them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The city ends at the sheer cliff wall at the bottom of the plateau. There stands a WOODEN PLATFORM that is lowered by a massive winch, unloading a cavalry regiment and then raising back up to the fortress above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's probably only way into Khalar's fortress. I'm sure it is heavily guarded at all times, day and night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we must try to scale the cliff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And dodge arrows as we do so? Conan motions up to the winch. Standing beside it are a half dozen of the four-armed ARCHERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During the day, we'd easily be spotted on the climb. And it would be useless to even attempt at night. No, we must find another way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Conan continues around the base of the mesa, the Figure following Conan is joined by TWO OTHERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan and Tamara reach a less crowded area of the village when a VOICE rings out behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Halt. Conan spins, sword at the ready. From out of the shadows comes a pair of MEN, their beady eyes fixed on Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thieves. You'll regret finding me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I think not. From out of the shadows steps the ONE-EYED THIEF, the same one who Conan saved from Lucius' beatings. He smiles at Conan, lifting a KEY from a rope around his neck
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It took longer than you think to cut this out of Lucius' stomach. After all that work, I figured I'd keep it -- for old times' sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rundown hall, built beneath the city. Wooden supports hold up the buildings of the entire city block overhead. And within the hall, a gathering of THIEVES and ROGUES. They're a flinty collection, many of them missing fingers or even hands, evidence of Khalar's cruel justice. They eat and drink, sharing tales and tips, WENCHES and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: their cautious eyes following the Cimmerian outsider. The One Eyed Thief takes them to an open table, and immediately three of the serving women descend upon Conan, caressing him. Tamara watches this, jaw dropped, and manages a COUGH, even as a SERVING GIRL delivers mead to the table. Conan just smiles as he enjoys the silky bodies of the nubile women, their breasts practically framing his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Do you wish to join in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan cleans mead from his face, scowling at Tamara, as the One-Eyed Thief uses the tabletop to explain the fortress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --so you were right about the platform. You'll be long dead before you make it top. Same with scaling the cliff. There's no known way to break into the fortress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that. I just said there's no known way in -- because no one has ever tried to. But breaking out -- that's another story. It's not much easier, but it's possible. The One Eyed Thief offers the same gap-toothed grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just need to find someone crazy enough to show you the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara is the last to follow Conan, the One Eyed Thief and the three THIEVES from before down a short ladder. Below lies a darkened catacomb, lit only by their torches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These catacombs run underneath the entire city, even to the cistern that drains out from the fortress dungeon. Tamara's foot drops into knee high water. She immediately grabs her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Catacombs? You mean sewers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piss and shit are the last things you need to worry about down here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tamara eyes the muddy water, nothing visible beneath its murky surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group wades through the water, single file. Conan notices
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and carvings on the wall of the catacomb. Massive creatures of the sea, dark sorcery, ritual sacrifice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A warning. These catacombs are connected to the sea. It says that the beasts of Acheron protect its secrets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not from me. Conan presses on, into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The catacomb widens out to a giant circular cistern, its walls rising up high into the darkness. As the torches bring light to the space, we see HUNDREDS OF DEAD, ROTTING BODIES. As Conan and Tamara walk forward, the One Eyed Thief and the other stop at the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, friend. We stop here. We've heard too much about what lies within to go any further. Conan simply nods and the thieves depart. Conan raises his torch, illuminating the near wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Around. Up. Conan heads off one direction, leaving Tamara to navigate the other half. Her torch illuminates the grizzly path ahead. She inhales deeply and takes her first step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Following the slick wall, he passes many DEAD BODIES, but only one catches his eye. He stops before it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing more than a skeleton, picked clean by the rats. But he still bears his leather armor, and a horned helmet that resembles his father's own. Conan takes the helmet and places it on his head. It fits perfectly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara is gingerly making her way through the knee high sewage water and the dead bodies submerged within.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh!!! Tamara leaps up, swinging the torch down towards the water. Conan, nearby, unsheathes his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something touched me. Something slimy. Conan walks over, the torchlight revealing something on Tamara's leg. It's a SLUG, which he flicks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crom! Stop wasting time. But when Conan steps forward, something ROILS THE WATER right before him. He spots a HUGE TENTACLE just before its submerges back into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crom indeed. Then Tamara SCREAMS as another tentacle rises up from the water, wrapping around her waist. Tamara grabs hold of the wall as the tentacle tries to pull her underwater. Conan immediately SLASHES the tentacle, pulling Tamara away. The squirming decapitated tentacle squirts black blood everywhere, the knee high water seems to come alive with roiling intensity. Conan spins, finding a circular stone staircase tiled into the far cistern wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they work their way up the circular stairwell, towards a thin shaft of firelight up ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carved out of solid black rock, both sides of the broad corridor are occasionally punctuated by thick steel doors, leading to prison cells. Conan and Tamara emerge from a sewer drain, pushing their way to the floor of the hallway. The heavy darkness presses in on Conan's torch like a sentient, animate thing. The floor of the corridor is lined with DEAD BODIES, in varying states of decay. There are buckets, filled with entrails and feces, upended. Tamara put her hand over her mouth. Conan continues down the hallway. He and Tamara begin to hear the sound of EERIE CHANTING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that? Up ahead, the torch-lined dungeon plunges into darkness as the torches end. Conan holds up his own torch, struggling to peer into the black void.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing good. Conan takes a step forward when suddenly a POWERFUL WIND blows out his torch. A moment later, there's the sound of A GATE WHISTLING DOWN AND CRASHING INTO THE GROUND. In the darkness, comes a DEEP, EARTHY CHUCKLE.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A GATE WHISTLING DOWN AND CRASHING INTO THE GROUND

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: revealing that the gate that closed behind them was actually just a door to a vast CAGE built around a massive PIT.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A HOST OF OIL LIGHTS SUDDENLY COME UP,

direction.raw_text: The same pit where Fariq sacrificed the female monk, only now, a half dozen COMBATANTS stand on the grid above the void. Hanging high above the pit, in baskets, lie other PRISONERS, including Tamara's fellow female monks. Several of them YELL out Tamara's name as they see her. And watching everything, from an amphitheater above the cage, is the massive Akhun and several of his slavers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which ever one of you slaves gets me the girl, lives. The Combatants all close in on Conan and Tamara, each taking a different plank way to get to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay behind me. Tamara steps behind Conan, who blocks the others' path to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who dies first? The first two COMBATANTS attack as one, the first wielding a short sword, the other a pike. The pikeman thrusts first, Conan deftly stepping aside, then pulling the pike, sending the wielder off balance and into the abyss. The prisoner with the short sword doesn't fare much better, as Conan evades his swipe and decapitates him with a single blow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara sees that the prisoner baskets are suspended by the top half of the metallic cage. She begins scaling the cage, her eyes set upon the imprisoned monks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three more COMBATANTS step in to replace the fallen duo. Conan readies himself as the first one steps up, only to have the combatant suddenly grabbed by a ENORMOUS TENTACLE, much like the one Conan cut through earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Up from the darkness of the pit comes a gargantuan monster; a gigantic octopus-like behemoth, with multiple tentacles that feed a pulsing black orifice lined with razor sharp teeth. The creature reaches out and grabs another SCREAMING combatants, lowering him to its mouth and devouring him in its gnashing maw. The creature reaches for Conan, who ducks underneath the tentacle, the slices it off. He immediately turns back to check on Tamara -- and he discovers she's not there. He looks up to see Tamara scaling the cage, now nearly fifty feet directly above him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crom!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The massive warrior spots Tamara getting close to the prisoner baskets and motions to his two Jailers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's reached the base of the chain supporting one of the baskets when she spots the two Jailers closing in, climbing towards her from either side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spotting Tamara overhead, Conan tries to keep beneath her, evading the swarming tentacles while balancing on the rickety planks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's scaling down the basket supporting chain when the first Jailer reaches out to grab her. She reacts by GASHING his eyes, and as he instinctively grabs them, he FALLS TOWARDS THE PIT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan barely dives out of the way as the fallen Jailer
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through the plank he was on, forcing Conan to jump to another. Just then another COMBATANT comes swinging for the Cimmerian, forcing him to defend while still not balanced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next Jailer grabs her, pulling her off the cage. He struggles to pull towards a nearby exit hatch when she BITES HIS EAR OFF. The Jailer drops Tamara, who SCREAMS as she falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan spots Tamara plunging towards him. In one swift move, he SLASHES his opponent, ducks underneath a writhing tentacle, and reaches out to GRAB TAMARA BY THE ARM AS SHE FALLS. His shoulder nearly pops out, but he manages to hold onto Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She swings above the chasm, the gnashing teeth of the monster below her. Only a single splintering plank holds her and Conan aloft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a grunt, he swings Tamara and throws her to safety, at the edge of the pit. But as he gets to his feet, he spots the massive Akhun entering the arena.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The giant warrior grins as he boards the same plank as Conan. He thrusts his thunderous legs down, causing the plank to bend and warp. Conan struggle to balance on the undulating plank, but his training in Cimmeria serves him well. Akhun smiles and step closer, again thrusting down with his legs. Conan's balance is thrown, but there's no other plank close enough for him to jump to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll make a nice meal. Akhun steps down on the plank one last time, but this time Conan uses the momentum to SPRINGBOARD UP INTO AIR. Conan soars into the air, his cat-like reflexes keeping him focused as he lands right before the stunned Akhun. With one great slash of his blade, Conan eviscerates Akhun.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: GRAB TAMARA BY THE ARM AS SHE FALLS

direction.raw_text: . Akhun's innards drop out of his belly as he falls into the abyss, only to be snapped up by the massive beast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan lowers down the last of the baskets. Tamara use a sword to smash open the lock, freeing the prisoners inside. Tamara shares hugs of joy with the other monks of her flock. The women look worn, but unbroken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is Ilira?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was taken away by Fariq.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'm too late. One of the stronger looking women, an ELDER MONK, steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She was just taken this morning. It's not yet midnight, and Khalar still must bring her to the cave of Acheron. Tamara nods and the women begin to ARM THEMSELVES. Conan shakes his head at the rag-tag group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to fight Khalar's troops? Just you? The Elder Monk grabs and nearby pike and twirls it expertly about her body, clearly well versed in it use.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cimmerians aren't the only women who know how to fight. And to kill. Tamara looks at the other monks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our duty was to keep the queen safe. We failed. But if Khalar brings her to Acheron, it will rise again -- and all our peoples' sacrifice is for nothing. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So if the queen is not free by the stroke of midnight -- she must be already dead. The other monks nod and they start to head off. Tamara is the last to head off, her eyes burning into Conan's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want my help again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You kept your word, I'll keep mine. I pray you fulfill your debt. Tamara kisses Conan's cheek one last time and heads off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The monk travel in single file, the Elder Monk leading the way. Suddenly, she stops, motioning to an entranceway ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't kill him. We need to find out which way Ilira was taken. The Elder Monk nods and slips up ahead. We hear a SMASH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stunned GUARD lies before the assembled monks. Tamara glares down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell us where the last girl was taken. The Guard just LAUGHS at them through bloody teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Let me ask. The Guard's face drops as Conan steps out from the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your debt -- 89.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will be where your queen is. Tamara smiles. She knows it is a half truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Conan and the monks enter, the throne room is empty, scattered light barely illuminating the expansive chamber. Ilira sits on the throne, crown on her slumped head. Tamara runs over to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ilira! She raises Ilira's head, only to discover lifeless eyes. Tamara cradles her best friend's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's dead. It's over.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ARROWS STREAK OUT FROM THE DARKNESS,

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Not yet. Before the monks can react, ARROWS STREAK OUT FROM THE DARKNESS, killing them all. Only Conan is quick enough to dodge his arrow by diving aside. When he comes up, Khalar has Tamara, his sword at her neck. Several ARCHERS stand behind him, at the ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only begun. Because that one was not the heir to Acheron. Khalar smiles down at Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is. Slowly, what he's saying dawns on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It can't be -- KHALAR SINGH Secretive, the traitors of Acheron. It wasn't easy, but Fariq finally wrung honesty from the girl. That poor innocent was forced to live a lie, even as the truth was kept from the queen herself. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (TO CONAN) And you did the rest, barbarian. My thanks for delivering the Queen to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Suddenly, a trap door opens beneath Conan and drops down in the darkness, landing with a heavy THUD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan awakens to the familiar sound of a hot blade SIZZLING as it hits the cooling vat. But this is no dream of his father's forge -- as he looks up to see Fariq holding a sword, its tip still red hot, the flames of the fortress's forge behind him. Conan's thrusts forward, only to find his armed chained around a heavy mortar and stone pillar. Fariq strokes his newly acquired scar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At last you awaken, Cimmerian. It's been hours you've made me wait for my fun. Conan says nothing, but his eyes scan the room, taking in everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made me lose face in front of my father. That wasn't wise. But what should I expect from a Cimmerian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A swift end! Conan strains at the chain, ripping the skin beneath his shackles -- but a thin wisp of mortar comes loose from the pillar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardly. But that is a difference between you and me. A swift end would be a mercy I do not intend to grant. No, you must suffer for your transgressions. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must beg for your suffering to end. Just as your people did. He waves the glowing sword tip in front of Conan's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lie. I was there. My father never uttered a sound. Fariq LAUGHS, amused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were there? What were you doing, warrior? Watching your father die, without saying a sound? Taking your eyes will be justice indeed, coward. Fariq pushes the hot tip of the sword against Conan's skin. Conan's face reddens with pain, but he doesn't utter a sound. But as Conan pulls on his chains -- more mortar falls. As Fariq turns back to place the sword in the forge, Conan notices one of the bricks the chains are fastened to is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw my father die. Slain by one who can only kill men already on their knees. Fariq turns, his eyes blazing. He glances over at the two
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: by the door, who try not to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've killed many in battle, cur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Then why did your father not let you face me before, when I had sword in hand. He thought you unequal to the task. Fariq responds by pushing the red hot blade against Conan's chest. Conan just YELLS back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coward! Prove your strength! Again, Fariq pushes the hot blade against Conan's skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take my eyes, coward -- if you can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fariq yells and thrust the tip of the sword at Conan's head. Conan lifts his manacles, forcing the blade up into the brick holding his chain. Then Conan pulls on the chains with all his might, loosening the heavy brick, which falls to the ground. In one powerful movement, Conan begins SWINGING the chain with the mortar block on the end, a homemade ball and chain. The two Guards come forward, sword drawn, only to meet with a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blow by Conan's weapon. Both their heads get caved in. Fariq rushes Conan, getting in too close for Conan's wide swings. Conan simply meets Fariq's sword with the heavy chains, then encircles Fariq's neck with the steel bonds. Fariq CHOKES, falling to the ground, gasping for air. But Conan doesn't kill him -- yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vat of molten steel bubbles in a cauldron within the forge. Conan uses tongs to lift the cauldron out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan kicks him onto his back. Fariq's last vision is that of Conan, tipping the cauldron, the hot iron descending toward his eyes. Fariq SCREAMS. Conan reaches down and picks up Fariq's sword. THE SWORD CONAN'S FATHER MADE FOR HIM.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE SWORD CONAN'S FATHER MADE FOR HIM

direction.raw_text: By torchlight, Khalar Singh leads his black-armored PERSONAL GUARD, two dozen men strong, across a rocky peninsula, jutting out into the sea. On the back of Khalar's horse, bound, rides the helpless Tamara. As they round a large rock spire they spy a fearsome and awe inspiring sight. A massive SKULL, seemingly a natural rock formation, rises over the peninsula. As they ride closer, we can make out one more detail -- the mouth of the skull is actually a massive door, at least sixty feet high, and seemingly made up of jagged bone. It has the appearance of teeth, completing the skull illusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It takes the full complement of soldiers to open the enormous doors. Khalar Singh rides in. Moonlight from the huge eyes of the skull illuminate terrifying faces in the darkness. Faces of demonic warrior statues. At their feet lie the decaying bones of human skeletons, too numerous to count.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is no empire, only a graveyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see only with your eyes. Khalar nods to his men. Two Guardsmen take their torches and light other torches set in the walls. It sets off a chain reaction. As far as the eye can see torches ignite revealing the true scope of this place. An enormous cave, the walls lined with monumental columns that frame countless bas relief carvings of demonic origin. And at the far of the cave, an ALTAR sits beneath a raised
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: surrounded by a SACRIFICIAL POOL. The pool is empty. Khalar turns to his guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close the gates and stay here. Send my son to me when he arrives. (motioning to two of them) You two, come with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar dismounts at the sacrificial altar, carved of out of purple-shaded rock. Around its edges are deep channels, for the blood of its victims. And on its four corners -- shackles of bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Acheronians had a wonderful sense of balance, don't you think? For one to ascend to royalty, another must fall. With the flick of a wrist, Khalar cuts Tamara's bonds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tamara head butts him, struggling to escape, but Khalar absorbs the blow effortlessly. He throws Tamara upon the altar, his two guards shackling her in place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a hundred generations the kings of Acheron were crowned, and the queens were sacrificed. Khalar snaps his fingers and two guardsmen bring an ornately carved BOX MADE OF BONE, laying it before the altar. Like a Chinese puzzle box, Khalar manipulates the carvings of skulls, sacrifices, and creatures until the box UNLATCHES. And from the box he lifts two items. A CROWN OF GOLD and A CROWN OF IRON. The crown of gold is magnificent, ornately detailed gold that glows in the firelight. But the crown of iron is terrifying. Huge rough spikes extend from it in every direction. It looks more like a weapon than a crown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a day for you. This morning you were a handmaiden. Tonight, you are a queen giving birth to an empire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bloodied and weary, Conan approaches the Skull Rock. He has nothing more than his sword, his loincloth and a small BURLAP SACK tied to his hip. He stumbles, falling to his knees. His wounds have taken a grave toll. Still he stands and presses on. He pushes on the doors. They do not budge in the least. He puts his shoulder to the doors -- his every muscle straining to their utmost. Again -- no movement. Conan backs away, taking stock of the surroundings. He climbs up the side of the rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar Singh CHANTS in Acheronian. Ancient, harsh words, as he lifts the two crowns overhead, offering them to the statues of dark gods all around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop. You don't know what you are about to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I do. For thirty years I have dreamed of this day. The day our people rise from the ashes. Khalar Singh continues his chant and places the gold crown upon his head. As he does so, the light from the moon reflects off the crown, bathing the sacrificial pool in an unnatural glow.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AS THE SPIKES DRIVE THEMSELVES INTO HER HEAD

direction.raw_text: . A deep and foreboding sound echoes throughout the cave, shaking everything like an earthquake. It sounds like the heartbeat of a giant. Khalar next places the iron crown around Tamara's head. She thrashes and struggles but to no avail. Once the crown is around her head -- THUMP-THUMP! The spikes around the iron crown grow shorter AS THE SPIKES DRIVE THEMSELVES INTO HER HEAD. She SCREAMS in agony. Blood drips from beneath the crown, flowing into channels around the edges of the altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It begins. You give birth to an empire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan climbs -- muscles straining -- slipping -- hanging on by one hand -- and climbing again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The statuary shakes, indeed the whole earth does. Conan nearly slips, but keeps his grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crom. He reaches the eye of the skull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the moon over his shoulder, Conan stares down at the unholy sight before him. We pull back revealing Tamara, her blood draining from her body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara, her face pale from blood loss, begins to pray in pained whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's good that you pray. Gods will be here soon. Tamara struggles to speak, her body wracked with pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll--be---here--sooner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Me! Khalar turns to see the outline of Conan, framed by the moonlight, looking down at Khalar from atop of one the warrior statues. A thick vine dangles nearby, Conan's route down from the cave roof above. Conan then leaps down to the skeleton covered floor before the altar. It is a killing floor. The two Guardsmen leap for him, but Conan dispatches them with a pair of strikes. Both fall down dead. Conan meets Tamara's eyes, a look of determination, assurance. He starts toward the altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will say this for you, barbarian. You are hard to kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've faced me before and lost. What do you think has changed now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My purpose. Conan lunges for Khalar, their swords meeting with a flash of sparks. They fight to a brief standstill when ---THUMP, THUMP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tamara writhes in pain as the spikes drive deeper into her head. More blood pours forth. The blood in the channels speeds up and finds the channel leading down to the sacrificial pool. Conan makes another movement toward the altar, but Khalar nimbly blocks his path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are strong, Cimmerian, but we both know you are not my equal. Conan takes the burlap sack wrapped at his hip pulls it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once you used my father to teach your son a lesson about strength. Now let me teach you. Conan tosses out what is inside. It falls to the ground, rolling to Khalar Singh's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar looks down at the ground -- at the head of his beloved son, his eyes gone, replaced by molten metal. Khalar trembles in shock and rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Khalar reaches for the severed head, giving Conan a brief window to rush to Tamara's side. Conan tries to lift her off the altar, but the bone shackles still pin her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cimmerian!!! Enraged, Khalar CHARGES Conan throwing all his skill and force into an all-out attack. Conan simply sidesteps it, then shatters the bone shackle holding one of Tamara's wrists. Before he can shatter the other, Khalar charges again. Khalar swings, Conan spins, his blade catching Khalar's just inches from his face. Conan throws Khalar off him, knocking the warlord back ten feet. Khalar's attack is feral, uncontrolled. He's lost his balance. Spinning and striking blindly, Conan smashes the second shackle on her wrist. He continues his motion, bringing his sword around to meet Khalar's next strike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Now Khalar looks like the enraged amateur, and Conan the more polished warrior. Their battle takes them away from the altar. With her hands free, Tamara struggles to pull the spikes out and remove the crown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan repels another Khalar attack, this time striking Khalar's chest and drawing blood. The Guardsmen arrive from the other side of the cave, drawing their swords. Khalar waves them off, his fury aimed at the Cimmerian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Queen. Shackle her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In agony, Tamara pulls one of the spikes out, then another. She pushes with all her might, lifting the crown of iron off her bloodied head -- When the Guardsmen charge her, pin her down, and force the crown back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The crown spikes imbed themselves even deeper as Tamara SCREAMS. The blood now fills the channels of the altar.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- THE FIRST DROP OF TAMARA'S BLOOD TOUCHES THE SACRIFICIAL POOL

direction.raw_text: the trail of blood, down the side of the altar, in a spiral channel around the leg, and in a wide circle around the altar until reaching the channel's end -- THE FIRST DROP OF TAMARA'S BLOOD TOUCHES THE SACRIFICIAL POOL. It BOILS instantly, multiplying itself exponentially, bubbling forth and filling the entire pool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A massive earthquake jolts the entire cave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Khalar Singh and Conan battle, the ground beneath them on the wide cave floor CRACKS and SPLINTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The earthquake intensifies and the entire floor of the cave GIVES WAY, tumbling into an incredible abyss. Conan and Khalar alike grab onto the only rocks they can reach to prevent them from falling further.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Conan ends up against one of the walls on the side of the cave. Khalar clings to the rocks on the edge of the sacred pool. Their bodies are illuminated by a fiery glow. They look below, searching for the source of the glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another two hundred feet deep lies the golden spired city of ancient Acheron. The cave is but a forechamber, the slightest taste of the true glory and horror of Acheron. And as they stare down into the ancient city, the shadows there MOVE. Is it a trick of the light? No. Whatever the dark forms are, they are coming this way, climbing the tallest demonic spires and leaping impossibly far to climb up after Conan and Khalar Singh. Khalar gazes down at the city with wide eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beyond my dreams -- THE ALTAR Tamara, her body's blood nearly drained, is still shackled to the altar, which now teeters over the edge of chasm, poised to fall into the fiery depths.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other side of the abyss, Conan spots her and scales the cave wall, up to a tiered plateau. He moves quickly, trying to get to Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar watches, entranced, as the first of the creatures rises out of the pit. They climb the walls like insects, clinging to the walls, their heads swiveling like a praying mantis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The look like the statues above -- a hybrid -- part human, part demon. Their skin is a perfect black, armor carved of black bone, faces once human but now demonic with blood red eyes and gnashing teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They advance on Khalar Singh, who is furthest down now that Conan climbs upward towards Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Khalar Singh, King of Acheron. I command you to kneel! And this demonic horde advances right for him, their razor sharp teeth bared. Unsure, Khalar grips his tulwars tight. The demonic creatures draw close, and they -- kneel. They climb out of the abyss and immediately lower their heads before Khalar Singh. Out of the corner of his eye, Khalar spots Conan, drawing near.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (IN ACHERONIAN) Show him the might of the army of Acheron! But they do not rush to follow the order. They stir. One of them with more ornate bone armor than the rest looks over at Khalar's Guardsmen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First, we feed. Its voice is somewhere between a whisper and a hiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. Take your fill. I will kill him myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan is on an intercept course with Tamara, leaping across chasms from statue to statue. Just below him, the first wave of Acheronian Warriors reach the Khalar's remaining Guardsmen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar's Guardsmen, who have been watching the events with mouths agape, realize the danger too late. The horde of Acheronian Warriors leaps on them and a massive battle ensues between the demonic warriors and the soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His climbing is dizzying, reminiscent of his youth scaling the cliffs of Cimmeria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Intercepts Conan just below the altar, his tulwars at the ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your story ends here. The two warriors square off, fighting even as they cling to the statues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The demon warriors not only slay Khalar's Guardsmen, but rip their still living bodies apart, dousing themselves in the blood of their victims. It is a violent ritual, both Bacchantic and gruesome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Launches himself at Conan, his tulwars sparking off the stone statuary. Conan leaps to another statue, parrying the blows. Khalar overextends himself, and Conan's sword just barely misses his throat. Khalar pulls back, tries to settle himself. Conan's eyes narrow, he knows what Khalar is doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a woman, Fariq cried and begged me to spare him. Khalar ROARS in rage, launching an all-out offensive. Conan backs up slowly, waiting for his moment. And it comes quickly. Conan ducks below the tulwars and CUTS Khalar across the stomach. Khalar loses his balance and falls, one hand grabbing a protruding statue arm, dangling over the abyss. Conan raises his sword to finish the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Conan!!! Conan glances down. The Acheronian Commander drank his fill, and now moves to the altar itself, his claw stroking Tamara's body. With one touch, the shackles open. He and the Acheronian Warriors drag her pale body toward the abyss. Khalar grins up at him through bloody teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They take her to a place you can never follow. Who will you fail, Cimmerian? Your father or your woman? Conan leaps down to the altar. The Acheronian Warriors attack. Standing atop the altar, Conan cuts down all comers, cutting his way through the enemy, working his way to Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara!! They leap on Conan, impossibly fast. They stab him. They cut him. But he does not stop. Even wounded, he throws them into the abyss. And he reaches Tamara, just before the Commander drags her below. He grabs her arm. The Commander grabs her other arm, baring his shark-like teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Conan punches him in the mouth with his free hand and the Commander falls into the abyss. The bloody Conan pulls Tamara up into his arms. Only for Tamara to scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan! Conan spins just in time as Khalar strikes. Khalar's tulwar narrowly misses, and Conan counters. His father's sword runs Khalar Singh through. Khalar's body falls into the abyss. But the Acheronian Warriors surround them. Thousands climb out of the abyss, teeth bared, closing in on the wounded Conan. Tamara, badly weakened herself, grabs Conan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan, you know what you must do. Kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is the only way to end this. My death gives others life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cannot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must. Your parents both understood that purpose. Now it is yours. Live, Conan. A tear falls from Tamara's face. The demonic warriors prepare to strike. Conan drives his sword into Tamara's heart. The crown spikes retract and it falls from her head, tumbling into the abyss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A seismic explosion shakes everything, an unearthly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulling the Acheronian Warriors back down into the abyss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cave begins to fall, massive sections of the roof dropping in to decimate the pyramid and the city below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan pulls Tamara's body away, even as the world descends into dust and debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khalar's HORSE stands near the entrance. Conan puts Tamara's body carefully atop the horse, then mounts it himself. He positions her in front of him, his arms encircling her. Conan gives her lifeless body one last kiss, her blood staining his lips red, as his mother's did as a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A blazing sun threatens to explode over the nearby mountains. Conan holds a single torch in his hand. His look is hard. Grim. We pull back to reveal a funeral pyre, Tamara's body atop it. Conan places the torch to the pyre. It quickly spreads. We move in, closer and closer upon Conan's ice blue eyes, a blazing fire erupting in them. A fire that will never be extinguished.
direction.name: direction
